reviews.text: Ordered pickup with many stuff including the &#34;thai wrap with grilled avocado&#34;... I don&#39;t know if you can tell from the picture the avocado were hard as rock!!! Cant peel it nor barely chow on it!!! How can serve something like that?! very disappointed  at cheesecake factory

I can&#39;t typically take or leave Cheesecake factory for dining in for a few reasons... I hate how loud and constantly chaotic it is no matter the location and I did find this location was still too loud for a restaurant of what they try to be same with being constantly chaotic with the staff seeming to run every where they went and it was not overly crowded at all and it was a peak dining time, so for this I took away a star on this review. However this location my food was beyond excellent. I&#39;ve never had anything from Cheesecake Factory that was outstanding. Nothing bad but nothing to remember until this particular visit I had the chicken Marsala and it was fantastic!! Taste, quality and quantity! I was very pleased and will actually return again soon and look forward to it. <br>This location is attached to a mall so during busy shopping days plan to possibly walk a bit or enter the mall through a less busy entrance however having mall parking lot available does mean ample parking. The restaurant inside and out appeared clean and tidy. The hostess was a bit uninterested in her job but was functioning however our waitress was super friendly and astute. <br>I would suggest dining at this location.
The fried Mac and cheese is above and beyond but the Alfredo had a bad taste and the noodles were not pleasant.

My husband and I visited after Sunday service and it wasn&#39;t until then that I realized that they serve brunch! This was my first visit since they&#39;ve been in Memphis. <br><br>I enjoyed the atmosphere a lot. The lights are dimmed and they place nice music too. It helps set the mood. The servers are friendly and very attentive to each table. They kept us up on water and bread as needed. <br><br>On to the food, I ordered Pancakes, eggs, bacon, and a peach drink (ugh...I forgot the name, but it&#39;s pictured). Everything was great! They have a special kind of syrup that they serve with the pancakes has like a hazel or butter pecan taste to it. I loved it, however they said that it can be a hit or miss with costumers. <br><br>Overall, I enjoyed our visit there and I will be returning.

WOW! This was my first visit and I was so impressed! <br><br>For starters, a rye dark bread is provided with the fresh cream butter. It was very yummy. <br><br>Based on reviews, we had the egg roll sampler appetizer and the chocolate hazelnut crunch cheesecake. Both were excellent. My favorite egg roll was the avocado one. We would definitely order the sampler again to get the variety. So fresh and crisp!<br><br>The cheesecake was delicious. It had Nutella icing on the top! The house made whipped cream on the side was very nice too. <br><br>On our own, we picked the French Country Salad. It was huge and we loved that the pieces were bite-sized. (Nothing worse than a salad with huge pieces of everything.) We felt like it was a healthy, tasty choice to balance out our cheesecake indulgence. <br><br>We ate outside on a beautiful September evening. The outdoor furniture was so comfortable! Lots of ambiance. Just not the best lighting for pictures. <br><br>Our server, Taylor J, really took care of us. She had such a positive spirit and energy! Thank you for the exceptional service, Taylor!

Went by for a weekday lunch. It was pleasant out so I opted for the patio. There were only 2 tables occupied on the patio including me. Service was EXTREMELY slow. They have a lunch menu plus their full menu. I ordered a salad and water to drink. After a really long time, the server brought my salad. It looked great but was really big. I asked the server if it was from the lunch menu and he said &#34;no&#34; I didn&#39;t tell him I was ordering from the lunch menu. My thoughts....it is lunch time and I ordered a dish that is offered as a lunch special. The server tried to take my dish to go bring me the lunch portion. I told him absolutely not.....I am keeping what I have and you will figure it out. Anyway, I had the southwest salad. It was good as usual. No dessert for me this trip. Cheesecake Factory generally doesn&#39;t disappoint so I will be back.

Made reservations at 3 to eat at 4 when I arrived they placed me outside or over 40 min. And when I questioned when I would be seated I was treated very rudely by staff and did not receive answer overall absolutely disgusted with the customer service. I only hope store manager reviews how poorly customers are treated

&#34;Yeah, your phone number and one more cheesecake.&#34; -- The Big Bang Theory: Season 7 | Episode 11<br><br>Our experiences here are either hit or miss - it seems like the busier they are, the better thee service. This most recent occasion was the worst we have had. Service was slow and thee food seemed to be slopped on the plates very messily - it tasted okay, but looked terrible.<br><br>It seemed like our server (I forget her name now) did not really want to be working Wednesday evening and was not thrilled when the 3 of us were seated in her section. Each drink or food item ordered, seemed a nuisance. We were unsure on entrees, but she wanted us to place our appetizer and entree orders together (she she didn&#39;t have to come back?). It was odd.<br><br>Her refills of drinks was slow - I had to request more iced tea and she seemed a bit exasperated when I asked for it. She did bring me a new one versus a refill, which was nice. Alcohol refills too entirely too long for my coworkers and they were dying for water refills. I just don&#39;t understand why, when the restaurant is empty, this takes forever?<br><br>The Loaded Baked Potato tots were awesome - a new favorite for sure. But my orange chicken was brought to the table looking a mess. She had a hard time placing the hot plate down (it was stuck on her towel) and part of it started to slide off the plate - I had to help get it freed and scorched my hand in doing so. The rice was dried out and basically inedible. The chicken was fine, but if you can tell, sauce was strewn willy-nilly on the plate. Not sure if that happened in the kitchen or on its way to me. I was starving, so I ate what I could.<br><br>The cheesecake was pretty good - it filled me up enough. But I think the experience was enough to convince us not to come back again? I think we will drive farther from our hotel next month to try someplace else.

Terrible Terrible Terrible!!<br><br>Highly disappointed!! Came to the Cheesecake Factory for a graduation celebration. We made 3 different reservations  because of the COVID rules and restrictions.  These reservations was made a week and a half prior to our  visit August 8th, 2020. 11am that day received a call from a representative from the establishment to confirm reservations and explained that 3 different reservations were made and that we understood that only 6 people could sit at a table which was fine our only request was if each table could be in the same area. We were told that was ok. Fast forward to 7:30 our reservation time. We were told our table wasn&#39;t ready 17 people waited outside in the heat for an hour or more just to be told that only one table was ready and the other two wasn&#39;t ready yet. At this point we are livid because we were not only told by a representative that all table would be in the same area but what was the point of making a reservation when you still have to wait an hour after you left designated time. I talk to manager on duty Corey and he shows me a section in the outside mall area and as I told him we didn&#39;t care where we sit as long as we are all in the same section. So the problem was clearly identified as a communication problem with the employees. From the girl at the door and hostess who never communicated our concern with manager initially. Then we got our food and the food was terrible and I know for a fact the dish I always order from the Cheesecake Factory is delicious which is the Louisiana chicken pasta. This establishment needs to be revamped from the top up. They are running it how they want to. STEER CLEAR PEOPLE they are terrible . I&#39;m from Texas and I know for a fact that Cheesecake Factory is not suppose to be ran the way they are. There are people out there willing and able to work and provide great customer service to customers. Fire everyone and start over including the kitchen cooks. Food was disgusting!!!!!

So, I had to change the rating. I have made three visits and so far the only thing that i enjoy is the mahi tar tar ... and a slice of cheese cake of course.  <br><br>So far, each dish misses a mark. I&#39;ve had the honey truffle butter chicken. The honey is cooked down in the butter which means that the honey... is no longer honey. This means there is no real sweet and savory taste to the chicken. The mashed potatoes are the entire dishes saving grace.  <br><br>I am on a health kick now so I tried their chicken Tuscan from the skinny menu.... the tomatoes were basically charred and, yet again, no flavor is coming through the chicken. I&#39;ve found myself doctoring the chicken myself in order to enjoy the meal. <br><br>I really think the Chef probably needs to go back and learn how to create those dishes from other Cheesecake factories.  It is a little odd that I can enjoy the meal from one the same establishment in a different state and come home and find myself not pleased with any of their entrees.<br><br>Guess I&#39;ll stick with my mahi and a slice of cheesecake unless I find another appetizer that they have down.

The food is always good.  Calorie loaded but good.  Ordered the fresh strawberry cheesecake, Impossible burger with fries and chicken samosas.  The special sauces on the burger goes great with the fries.  Still not convinced that the burger was all plant based because the texture and taste was too much like beef.  Oh well, I guess I&#39;ll never know for sure.  Anyway...I will be coming back again.  <br><br>****Service starts out slow then they stop by your table every 5 seconds to check on you‍
Ordered a pineapple alcoholic beverage for my bday and it was horrible. Steak could&#39;ve been better for $30. Dessert was probably the best thing. Service was a 2/10.

This place was disgusting the silverware was dirty on the table with butter residue , there was a HUMONGOUS fruit fly, they also just served me pancakes with NO BUTTER NOR SYRUP.They told my cousin that there was no more waffles but they had pancakes all they had to do was put the pancake mix in the waffle iron. HORRIBLE

It&#39;s nice to know that you guys have booster seats as well as high chairs. My toddler enjoyed his tower of grilled cheese and fries. I enjoyed the appetizer the crab &amp; artichoke dip wished it was more of it:)) By the way, The waiter did come to the table to apologize. He said that he had given my salmon plate  to another table. Thank you for correcting the bill.

Been here before with standard restaurant experiences, but it has been slowly going downhill.<br><br>Last night my sister wanted to go here for her birthday dinner. Service was terrible. The menu was on a QR code like most restaurants which I love, but it took you to an online order menu for carry out. Asked our server for a drink list 3 times before giving up and not getting anything to drink but water. Terrible service, were ignored several times and left waiting too long for a Monday night. The server, whoever she is would be fired by me if I still was a restaurant manager. <br><br>Anyways, not worth going to this location anymore. Poor staff, poor experience, waste of time. Needs new management to fix this, some not too lazy to set up a real QR code menu and drink menu like every other restaurant.<br><br>I also got food poisoning and was out for 12 hours the next day, but that&#39;s not the reason for the one star.<br><br>This is a major company owned by shareholders, and ran by people with no experience on the local level. Avoid eating at, investing in, and having anything to do with other than shorting this company.

Got here at open doors on Wednesday. The people were warm and friendly and while the service was good the wait for our food took a lot longer than expected. <br><br>Generally the staff and ambiance was of the high standard that is expected from cheesecake factories everywhere. My very first cheesecake factory encounter was in Atlanta for a brunch, which was excellent and have been to several other locations over the years.<br><br>Overall the food was okay but unfortunately just okay and not above average which is what I had expected and it was not the same experience I have had at other locations. My meatloaf was less than terrific but my wife enjoyed her selection but wasn&#39;t wowed.<br><br>While it&#39;s a bit expensive for a lunch, but if you get the whole cheesesteak factory experience it is commensurate to the check however an  average or less meal and a wait of over 30 minutes for that meal fell short of my expectations. It&#39;s unfortunate but this is not going to be a regular choices in the future.<br><br>Too bad.

Food was delicious (reason for 3 stars) The server went MIA and kept forgetting small items.  She did not check on us and a few times I had to look for her. We ended up taking everything to go as she forgot items so I cancelled them before they arrived.  I will return but will decline being served by her...I do not recall her name but I do remember her.

We went for lunch today with reservations for four at noon. We were seated immediately on the patio and our server Dwayne started taking care of us the moment that we sat down. He was prompt with refills, food, and amazing service. Food was delicious and arrived quickly. Dessert with our coffee and Prosecco topped a great day and meal. We will definitely be back.

What is there to say, other than complete perfection!!  Had the lunch special, salad and pizza.  The salad was huge, and the balsamic vinaigrette dressing was delicious.  The flatbread pizza I ordered had everything on it and was so tasty!  It was big enough that my friend and I both brought half of our order home for dinner.  Our server was so attentive and kind, thank you!  We ordered cheesecake to go, and my raspberry, chocolate slice was delicious.  <br>If you haven&#39;t been, do yourself a favor and go!!  Can&#39;t wait to go back!!

This Place Is So Delicious! Very Nice Staff Here Too, It Get&#39;s Pretty Crowded But Still A Good Place, They Don&#39;t Just Have Desserts, They Also Have Well-Baked Fresh Foods Here! They Deserve 5-Stars!

We have dined at this restaurant three times and every time it turns out to be a disappointment. Sadly the restaurant has such potential with a great menu and facility.<br><br>Let&#39;s start with the service, poor at best. The restaurant seems to struggle even when slow. And if busy expect to wait.<br><br>Additionally we have had incorrect orders delivered and wilted lettuce in what should be a fresh salad.<br><br>The only positive is the delicious cheese cake.

This use to be my favorite place, but it&#39;s been going downhill. I&#39;m am in the parking lot literally writing this review! The waitresses were nice, BUT TWICE there was something in my water. The first time there was a chunk of black residue in my water and not sure how it was missed by the waitress. The second time there was a bug in my water! I&#39;m feeling uneasy and upset about this.

Crystal B is the best bartender. Her recommendation for the Mojito was very refreshing. The 6.50 happy hour menu from 4-6pm has no disappointments. I ordered the chicken pot stickers &amp; buffalo blast which is normally twice the price. You get the same great taste &amp; portion size. Hi
Cheesecake factory happy hour is the best. They have drinks and great food come between 4-6 you will not regret it

Our experience is always good here. But last night it was Superb! It started with the nice hostesses and then to our waitress. But the thing that took it over the top was a worker who was  walking by and noticed our appetizer plates were finished and proceeded to take them away without being asked. Come to find out later after asking, that he was the General manager Nick!! He asked if everything was good, to which we answered YES! Then Courtney came by who is also a manager I believe and checked in on us. She even chatted with us for a few minutes. Customer service is NOT dead here! ....and the food was Delicious btw..<br><br>Thank you, <br>The Stevens Family
My food was delicious. Absolutely no complaints. We dont dat here often, but we&#39;ve never been disappointed.

Another great Cheesecake Factory location! The service and the food never disappoint! Our server, Quisha, was very knowledgeable of the entrees, ingredients, etc and made sure that our meal was expertly prepared. We had the tuna poké, egg roll sampler, and pineapple chicken. Everything was delicious, and we were especially impressed with the poké bowl. The Cinnabon cheesecake was also delicious. Now...if we could just get someone to open one of these in Little Rock!

I&#39;ve been to this location a few times to try different things. I&#39;ve found some success in keeping it simple. Order something simple or cheesecake and things will be fine. Also, I&#39;ve found that going later at night is good if you don&#39;t like the crowds. The staff are usually nice and the place looks clean but there are times when the seats and tables are a little sticky. Like, there&#39;s a film left over from when they were wiped...probably from letting things air-dry.

Came here for lunch. I had the lunch special pizza and Caesar salad the salad was a very nice portion and the pizza was the everything with kalamata olives. The pizza was a disappointing cause it was very greasy to the point that the crust was soggy! The banana cream cheesecake is to die for very creamy and delicious.

Your bartenders are the BEST. In particular, Rachel and David!!! David greeted me with a &#34;Hello, Love!&#34; And proceeded to wait and bartend, going above and beyond. He went back for dressing that was missing from my salad, he went to get me hand sanitizer as I realized mine was missing. He did SO MUCH MORE than he had to. Their co-working skills together were very precious and complementary as well. Very encouraging of each other. <br><br>They are great. Don&#39;t overlook these fine people you have on your staff. Far better than the hostesses that wouldn&#39;t even greet us.
I really enjoyed my time here tonight. Was busy due to special 1/2price cheesecake ...couldnt pass up...

Ambiance   Service   Food<br><br>I was greeted &amp; seated as soon as I entered.  <br><br>Typhoon Punch ($10.50) ~ Absolute Raspberry Vodka with Passion Fruit, Orange, &amp; Pineapple Juices was delicious.  <br><br>Almost every menu item looks good to me.  A selection to please everyone.  <br><br>Though the restaurant was about 3/4 full, my Lunch was served in 10 minutes.  <br><br>I enjoyed a Green Salad with House Vinaigrette &amp; bowl of Chicken Corn Chowder ($8.95).  Server checked on me twice.  <br><br>Decor &amp; Ambiance are top notch.  &amp; That cooler full of cakes near the Entrance is soooo tempting!

I have enjoyed eating at this restaurant all over the USA.  The service was slow, the burger poorly presented, with a lump of shredded cheese unmelted on top.  It burger was just some comfort food to celebrate a new hire. It was a dripping greasy mess. They can serve much better than this. Somebody is not watching the kitchen staff and waitresses.

We had a wonderful lunch today. It is a definite stop for us when we go to Memphis. Needed to stop by The Apple Store first but it was worth the 20 minutes more (40 minute round trip). Our waitress went out of her way to make sure we enjoyed our lunch. We took our cheesecake to go. I brought an insulated bag &amp; we bought 3 bags of frozen vegetables to keep it cold for the 2 1/2 hr drive home.  We are now enjoying our cheesecake this evening! The manager even came over to make sure we were enjoying our visit. Will keep returning. Good thing we don&#39;t live closer! Diet, what diet?!

I ordered fettuccini alfredo and fried cheese via Uber Eats.  The fried cheese was bland and tasteless, while the fettuccini alfredo was so salty, it was not edible.  I was quite disappointed, especially since it was so expensive.
Very nice restaurant (very similar to the rest of the chain). The service was great and the food was delicious as always.

My husband and family went there yesterday. My hubby ordered the philly cheese steak sandwich and while eating it he started not feeling well. My husband has been in the er since after eating here he has gotten food poisoning I will be calling the manager today 100 dollars in food just to spend thousands in the hospital. Also I googled sick from Cheesecake Factory and there have been multiple reports among all cheesecake factories in the last 7 days

Upscale dining, good food, great dessert. Pricey. Made from scratch? Is it really a factory? <br><br>I had to come check out all this hype. I&#39;d heard the menu was extensive, so I wanted to check it out online first. The online menu doesn&#39;t seem to work really well with an android mobile. I could read a partial description for each item, and see a camera icon, but whenever I&#39;d click on these, it would take me in a circle back to the start again. Also, I couldn&#39;t find any prices at all on the online menu.<br><br>Price is a determining factor in making a menu choice. Remember in Slingblade, Carl wanted to know if they had French fried potatoes? Then he asked how much do you want for them? Only then was he able to make a decision to buy some of the bigguns. Without that information, I cannot make a smart choice. <br><br>We walked in and were in awe of our surroundings. It&#39;s a big place, modern, and fancy. Of course, you see the dessert counter as soon as you walk in. We arrived at 1:00 Tuesday afternoon to avoid the crowd, were seated right away, and had excellent service.<br><br>The menu is massive. We all came for a small lunch with dessert. I normally don&#39;t eat sweets, but I like cheesecake occasionally, and that&#39;s what I came for. I noticed the menu does not list prices for beer and most of the desserts. I also noticed it doesn&#39;t say the size of the pizza. It still wasn&#39;t easy to make a smart choice. I was hoping the lunch menu would have something in store for me, but even the lunch specials ranged from $11.00 to $14.50. I know it&#39;s a nice place, but this is pricey. $3.00 for a glass of tea? Why? Chicken biscuits were $17.00 if I remember correctly! I don&#39;t want a complete meal, and I don&#39;t want to spend everything I have. Also, the menu is so large, that it takes a lot of research to select something.<br><br>The honey wheat bread was good. The sour dough was so tough it was hard to eat. The butter was too cold to spread. The crab artichoke dip was good, but the bread was extra tough. Crab balls, Greek salad, Asian lettuce wraps were just ok. The desserts and milkshakes were excellent. We asked what kind of ice cream the shake was made from, and the waitress said it just comes in on a big truck. Hmm. Not made from scratch.<br><br>We asked the server if she gets to take food home. She said they don&#39;t allow employees to take food home and they throw all the extras in the dumpster every night. Funny, the website says under fun facts under FAQ, that they donate all of the extra food to feed hungry people through Harvest.<br><br>She said they make all the cheesecake daily. Funny, the website doesn&#39;t say that. Everything I could find online says the cheesecake is trucked in frozen. Not really a factory is it? More of a restaurant that buys from a factory. I can get frozen cheesecake from the grocery. <br><br>Beef? What is American style Kobe? Kobe must come from Japan, period. There&#39;s no such thing as American Kobe. What they are selling is Wagyu. Some of the steaks are labeled as premium certified black Angus. Are we talking prime, select, choice? Are they aged? Some steaks are USDA branded, but again there are no descriptions beyond that. An educated diner knows this doesn&#39;t necessarily mean that they offer a superior beef product. <br><br>What does it mean that your fish are line caught when possible? Is this supposed to enhance the perception of quality? How does the customer know when it was possible? I always thought long lines were dangerous to birds.<br><br>I&#39;m always skeptical of the marketing phrase      &#34;made from scratch&#34;,  especially when it is used vaguely. &#34;Made from scratch&#34; comes from sports and means to start off without an advantage. The menu is not specific enough to make it mean anything at all. Do they grind flour? Do they make fresh pasta? Do they make their cheesecake from cream cheese, or do they make the cream cheese? Do they make the cream? I can&#39;t find any evidence (other than our waitress saying so) that this restaurant even makes the cheesecake. Then you&#39;ve got Oreos, peanut butter, Graham characters, ..... it&#39;s endless.<br><br>Any fast food could claim that everything is made from scratch daily, because somewhere, it is. Astronomer Carl Sagan said &#34;If you wish to make an apple pie from scratch, you must first invent the universe.&#34; I&#39;m pretty sure we wouldn&#39;t even be here if not for the universe, so &#34;made from scratch&#34; wouldn&#39;t be possible. <br><br>The service and food were ok, but this just isn&#39;t the place for me.
The cheesecake factory <br>It&#39;s deliciousness is overwhelming.<br>This place is devine I will eat here often. The dishes are wonderfully made. The drinks are on point. I give it five stars total.

I can&#39;t even give this place at least 2 stars, because my dining experience was that bad.<br>I can&#39;t complain about the wait time, it was relatively short compared to waiting for a table at The Cheesecake Factory in Hawaii.<br>My husband and I hadn&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory in over 2 years, and we were disappointed to say the least.<br>First off, the bread and butter were presented poorly. While the bread was in its usual basket, the butter was served to us in a dirty dish, &amp; it was just a thick square block. In Hawaii, the butter is wrapped individually which I feel is more sanitary.<br>We started with the crab dip appetizer which was so bad, we had them take it back. The crab dip itself was bad, and the bread it was served with was stale.<br>On top of that, our entrees were just plain bad. I ordered what I usually do-the chicken costoletta. There was no lemon zest, which it usually has (look up pictures) &amp; it lacked flavor. It&#39;s like they breaded the chicken completely plain..no salt or anything. My husband&#39;s meal was worse-he got the jambalaya, and the pasta all stuck together in one huge ball! Also, when he asked to have cheese for his pasta, our waiter didn&#39;t even know where the block was. When she found it, she handled it with a freaking napkin! I could&#39;ve sworn Cheesecake Factory had roller graters, one of the reasons being to avoid unsanitary handling..<br>This was an entirely disappointing experience.

I live in Chattanooga where we don&#39;t have a Cheesecake Factory so its always special for me to eat there. I can&#39;t believe how big the menu is. They literally have more entrees than just about anywhere else and based on my visit everything is good.<br><br>Then comes the desert. The list of deserts is amazing as is the quality of them. Service was great and we were seated quickly. It doesn&#39;t get much better than this for the price paid.

I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory&#39;s all over. This experience was just ok. It was a weeknight and not busy. Service was fine, meeting the minimum. Apps were good, needed extra sauce for my pasta. Long Island wasn&#39;t strong but I didn&#39;t send it back.

I came here with my work (Painting with a Twist) for our holiday dinner party and it was fantastic!!! I had never been before and the ambience made it feel like you weren&#39;t even in the mall.<br>The service was great and friendly, all of our appetizers were delicious, and they had a good selection of Sauvignon Blanc (which not all restaurants have anymore). <br>I ordered the shrimp angel hair pasta without marinara sauce and they could have easily left it dry and tasteless but it was tossed in garlic, butter, and some heavenly spices. I will for sure be back!!

Now I happen to really like The Cheese Cake Factory but this is by far the worse location I have ever been to. The food was horrible. I tend to always order the same thing which comes with white rice, my rice was hard like it had been sitting around all day. My wife&#39;s burger came but was super small (the meat patty), we sent it back and another never came out. We waited about 30 minutes only to be told they can&#39;t remake it. The staff seemed annoyed from the moment we walked in, slow service even though the place wasn&#39;t even full or busy.

Worst service ever. Ordered a chocolate cake tiramisu cheesecake and carrot cake, waited for 20 minutes and when I finally walked up to ask if it was ready it was already just there. We should have checked it first but total fail on the service.....

Once in a blue moon, I&#39;ll find myself craving some good ol&#39; cheesecake. Yep, it&#39;s a chain and all, but those thick slices last a good while. I barely finish it in one sitting. Anyways, I&#39;m always upset that it&#39;ll take like 10-15 minutes just to get one slice to go! This happens to me everytime, even during less busy times. They need a better system of handling to go customers. Saturdays here are a big mess too. Expect the wait time to be long and ridiculous.

Went to the restaurant and sat at the bar. Had to ask for refills. The waitress was sweet so it wasn&#39;t to much of an issue. However, once the roach crawled across the counter while I was finishing my drink it became an issue. They didn&#39;t seem to be worried ab it. I asked for the manager and an employee asked if it was that big of a deal. I emailed corporate and still haven&#39;t got a reply 5 days later.

I have always enjoyed the food at the Cheesecake Factory and the new Memphis location doesn&#39;t disappoint. <br><br>We had a great experience from start to finish. <br><br>I like the fact that you don&#39;t have to go inside the Wolfchase Galleria mall to access this restaurant. ;-) <br><br>I&#39;ve never been to a Cheesecake Factory that didn&#39;t have a wait.  So expect to put your name down, get a pager and wait to be buzzed for seating.  To kill time, some people sit, others look inside nearby stores in the mall and still others go to the bar. <br><br>The menu is a million pages so you might want to google it before you get there to save time.  The good thing about the extensive menu is that there is something for everybody!<br><br>I suggest you save your appetite before you go to Cheesecake Factory.  The portions are hefty and you want to make sure you have room for the delicious cheesecake.  <br><br>They honestly have the best cheesecake I&#39;ve ever had.  I get it plain - it has a yummy layer of sour cream on top.  <br><br>Their cheesecake melts in your mouth and the food is so delicious. <br><br>Be prepared to roll outta there!

Excellent mimosas!! The pancakes were very good, it&#39;s not exactly maple syrup, has an under tone of butterscotch.  Syrup is warm n complimentary to pancakes,  however. Bacon cooked n delicious, eggs cooked as ordered. Very nice brunch indeed.
They have a large menu to choose from.  Some dishes are hit or miss.  They have great bread
We had an enjoyable lunch time eating experience here. The service and the food were great. I do feel like that there are too many items on the menu.

Customer service at this restaurant needs to be improved.  I called the restaurant and was placed on hold for 8 minutes and as a result I called the restaurant from another line where I was on hold for another 6 minutes. I do enjoy the food and dessert here but this a deterrence, ordering food should not be an ordeal.
Thai lettuce wraps always my goto. <br>Always save room for the red velvet cheesecake. <br>If getting hot tea try orange spice, ask for the set up- honey and lemon!

As a huge cheesecake lover i was ofc excited to eat here! In Canada we dont really have any, i know of one but i hear its always very busy. We got in at around 4:30 so it was not very crowded. We were greeted by a very nice waitress and the service throughout was fantastic! The menu had a lot of variety so it was hard to choose, i ended up getting the orange chicken and it was so damn yummy! My friend got the tuscan chicken and she said it was amazing! We split a reese peanut butter cheesecake for dessert and omfg it was so yummy, im a plain cheesecake kind of guy but wow that made me wanna try there other flavours. I got a plain and a salted caramel cheesecake to go and so looking forward to trying them. Will definetely come back when i come to Memphis again!

This is the closest CF around, so when we have to come out to the Memphis area, I try to stop by at least for a slice of cheesecake. Actually came to eat here for the first time after a swim meet.<br><br>Seating hostess was COMPLETELY rude. Wow. Asked for a booth when she offered that we could go seat ourselves in the bar area and she sat me and my two daughters &#34;outside&#34;, the patio area inside the mall. We were the ONLY ONES she put us out there. Yes, I know because with a little one who constantly has to go, I&#39;d notice the empty booths inside were slowly beginning to fill up. Awesome. <br><br>Megan B was our waitress and was sweet and very professional. She acknowledge my youngest, 4 yrs old, and she would light up every time Megan would ask her a question directly or brought her food to her and talked directly to her.<br><br>We ordered: chicken bellagio, classic cheeseburger, kids pasta with a  side of green beans. The food was delicious and what we expect from CF. We ordered some cheesecake to go as well as their thai peanut sauce.<br><br>Another thing was there was a male waiter and male bus boy who would come to the area we were sitting in every 10 minutes to check their phones. One even stayed on their phone as they put out plates and utensils on the tables near us as we watched him. Pretty sure you shouldn&#39;t be doing that around customers, right? <br><br>Megan and the food were the saving grace of this visit. But the rest of the staff......

I am a huge fan of the cheesecakes and cakes and have tried about 25 of their various types. I always buy the $25 gift cards in Dec, to receive the free cheesecake cards for Jan/Feb. I just picked up my free cheesecake only to find that they reduced the size of their cheesecakes. I think it&#39;s because, for these first 2 months, everyone will be picking up their free slices. Their slices were the normal size in Dec. They did this same thing a few years back and I cannot believe that they still charge $8-$9 for the reduced size slices. VERY DISAPPOINTED!

we made a reservation on yelp. 30 minutes after our reservation we were still waiting and I think they have out table to another by the way the lady at front was talking to another coworker. what a poor experience.
Had the chicken parmesan sandwich and it was delicious. Also, the cinnabon cinnamon swirl cheesecake was amazing.

I&#39;ve been here probably 5 times. The last three times all of the silver wear was dirty. My water cup had mouth mark on it from the previous user and there were particles floating in my water. The server returned with more silver wear but it all seemed to have residue and old food. Disgusting. I usually like CKF, but not this one.
Great service. Great food. AMAZING cheese cake. It was a nice visit and I&#39;ll definitely be back.

This is only the second Cheesecake Factory I have been to, the other being in Oklahoma City. This one was just not as good. The service definitely needs to be improved. Our server didn&#39;t really pay attention to us and forgot a few of our requests, sometimes twice, like bringing us extra ranch dressing, napkins, and forgot to refill a couple of times. The food was still very good though. I&#39;m not going to let the service keep me away from this Cheesecake Factory in the future but if it&#39;s bad again, that might be it for me.

We used to like this place but, the wait and poor service just isn&#39;t worth it. We walked in and as usual, there was a huge wait list. We enquired how long and we&#39;re told 20 minutes, no problem. At 25 minutes, I asked how much longer and was told they were clearing tables and it would take a couple of minutes as we were next on the list. 15 minutes later, we walked it. This is the third strike for this place. I suspect they charge a buttload if money because a lot of people walk. We weren&#39;t the only ones. This was the one at Wolfchase in Memphis <br><br>Tried it again. Just not worth it. So, we get seated, barely anyone in the place. Waited for server. Waitress asked if we wanted bread and we said yes. It finally came out after we had ordered and ate. BTW, they don&#39;t hand grate cheese anymore, not that our server even offered. In fact, barely saw her. If you want cheese over your meal, it comes in a bowl with a spoon and it looks like plain old craft Parmesan cheese from Sams or Walmart. Sad really, really used to be a favorite place to go.
Love this place. Love the service. Love they have Death by Chocolate flourless cake for us Celiacs. We will definitely be back.

Who would&#39;ve thought that you could walk right into a Cheesecake Factory late on a Friday night and get service immediately? That&#39;s how it goes when you sit at the bar and then move out to the empty patio. That&#39;s how my #datenight went. We received good service and drinks at the bar. But, we took our party outside to sit more comfortably &amp; intimately. My pasta dish was very tasty. The chicken was tender and not chewy and I received just the fuel I need for my long run the next morning. We also received good information regarding the month&#39;s featured cheesecakes and pricing. I look forward to returning for more!

When coming here, be prepared to wait to eat for a while.  Arrived at 6PM with a group of 10.  There were plenty of tables open.  The drink service took a very long time.  1 hour 15 minutes later, we get food, and two orders were wrong.  The server then asked if I&#39;d like to just eat what they brought me, or if I actually wanted to wait for what I ordered.  So 25 minutes later, my food comes out and is still wrong. Due to my party being done eating, I quickly ate the order anyway.  They did comp my order and offer a poor excuse of an apology. The server walked by and mumbled, &#34;Sorry about the carne asada,&#34; and walked away.  At the end of the day, the food was good and would have been enjoyable without the other things.  Maybe focus on better training for staff and support them when they are struggling.

Cheesecake Factory was once an outstanding restaurant that had wait lines out the door.  Food was great...cheesecake was obviously great; however, last night was not so great.<br><br>1)  Cheesecake:  They used to serve Chris&#39;s Outrageous Cheesecake (UNBELIEVABLY GOOD).  I went to purchase and could not find it on the menu.  I learned they discontinued it.....WTH!  - I already knew where Cheesecake Factory was headed...same direction as the rest of the chain restaurants.<br><br>2)  Food:  We ordered the Louisiana Chicken Pasta.  Not the same...tasted horrible....greasy as hell.  My wife ate hers and had to immediately hit the restroom...when we took the leftovers home, I accidentally ate hers and guess what...I had to immediately hit the restroom :(.  <br><br>The customer next to us ordered the buffalo wings...had to send it back b/c it was raw from inside......TWICE...until she asked to drop the order.<br><br>3)  Price:  OMG....everything was pretty much $20.00+.  The Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp I remember used to be $14.00.....now it&#39;s $20....the Lousiana Chicken Pasta....$13.00...now $18.  The Fish and Chips....$13.00....now $20.  And the quality of food to go w/ the price...no comment.  I dont mind paying more but improve the quality if you are raising prices....let&#39;s not forget decreasing the quantity.<br><br>People will still visit...I doubt my comments will draw anyone away, but customers notice.<br><br>I will say our waiter was SUPERB.

My initial review was removed, and I was informed: <br><br>&#34;I&#39;m reaching out to let you know that our moderators removed your review of The Cheesecake Factory because it wasn&#39;t clear that your review described your firsthand experience as a customer of The Cheesecake Factory.&#34; <br><br>There were also pictures removed, as they came from local media, not me. I understand that and will refrain from using those. <br><br>Since they want my first hand account, here it is:<br><br>Location, Location, Location<br><br>On December 26, 2017, my family and I went to eat at The Cheesecake Factory in Memphis, TN to celebrate my youngest daughter&#39;s fifth birthday. It was an experience that will not soon be forgotten. The service was good and the food was wonderful. However, while waiting to order dessert, I observed a fight through the windows. Multiple individuals were fighting inside of the mall, just outside of The Cheesecake Factory. Security showed up and began forcing those involved outside. As they exited the mall (just feet from The Cheesecake Factory), approximately 8 gun shots rang out. I immediately grabbed my family and we got under the table, as did the entire restaurant. Realizing my oldest daughter (10) was in the restroom, I made my way through turned over chairs and other patrons on the floor to get to her. Once the scene appeared to be clear, I brought my daughter out of the restroom and back to the table. We continued sitting there, as multiple police cars arrived outside. I then observed police officers walking around the entrance and inside of the mall, with AR15 rifles. Just when we thought everything was under control, the officers with the riffles began running back toward the entrance where the shooting occurred. People in The Cheesecake Factory once again began screaming and got under their tables. After another few minutes of uncertainty, people began emerging from their hiding spots. Moments later, a female was taken out of the mall on a stretcher, by paramedics. We waited until it seemed as if everything had calmed down, and we paid our bill. On our way out, we observed an individual who had been shot. He was sitting handcuffed on the sidewalk surrounded by police, and was receiving medical attention. <br><br>Can I put the blame on The Cheesecake Factory? Yes, they knew the area has been declining and still chose it for their location. There are safer areas nearby that could have benefited from this business. <br><br>Additionally, it The Cheesecake Factory has any plan for an active shooter situation, it was not acted upon. The shooting happened just outside of the windows behind the cheesecake viewing area, yet the restaurant never went on lock down mode. Instead, customers were left to fend for themselves and seek their own hiding places. Also, the doors were never locked; therefore, the shooters could have easily entered the business. <br><br>As stated before, this was my five year old daughter&#39;s birthday dinner, in which she and her other sisters (6 &amp; 10) were forced to hide under tables and brought to tears. She later woke up with nightmares, asking if there were any &#34;bad men&#34; outside. This is an experience that my family will never forget.<br><br>Due to the location, I will not go back; however, I will continue to eat at The Cheesecake Factory when visiting other cities.

Loved it! We went for lunch today being a little concerned by the reviews on here. It was very good, and our waiter couldn&#39;t have been better.  I enjoyed the slider appetizer deluxe (fries added), and it was delicious. My husband had something off the brunch menu,  and he loved it. (The potatoes weren&#39;t his favorite.)  The restaurant was full, and the service was fast.  No complaints here!

Loving the bar today. Passion fruit martini is on point. The bartender got everyone high today. I hope I don&#39;t max out a card shop for Kimberly back to college stuff on the high. Love n the bar right now.

Made reservations for 12 with high chair.  Daid it would be 10 minutes.  Little mgr walked by and I ask if he setting long table for us.  Table got setup &amp; some high girls who were no even in rest when we arrived were seated in front of us.  I got face to face with asst manager.  THIS PLACE SUCKS.<br>AVOID IF POSSIBLE.

I had to change my review of The Cheesecake Factory in Memphis from 5 stars to 3 stars.  I have been to a number of Cheesecake Factory restaurants across the country, but I have never been to one that has been out of Buffalo Blasts not one time, but two times!  This restaurant needs to do a better job of hiring folks who are consistent in prepping their appetizers.  There is really no excuse for this and it is bad for The Cheesecake Factory brand.  Buffalo Blasts is like one of the main appetizers The Cheesecake Factory is known for.  It&#39;s almost like saying The Cheesecake Factory is out of cheesecake!

Worse decision ever to come here. The 12 year old birthday girl  requested to come here and we were told  the wait would be 60-90 minutes. Going in to hour 2 and no table yet despite  many empty tables. The hostess had an attitude and the manager was less than helpful. They should take reservations for parties of 9 like ours. Last visit here for me :<br>After meal comment: We enjoyed our meal and we had the best server ever. Destiny was the highlight of the evening! Very professional, knew the menu and was delightful. Not sure why she stays at the Cheese Cake factory. She could do much better!  <br>Again, this review would be totally different if they took reservations  at least for larger groups. But I hear that very long waits are the standard for them.
The cheesecake was delicious and the delivery was quick as I thought it would be been and they put there time and effort into there job and for that I thank them

Wow !!! This location is not representative of the CCF franchise. The food taste and quality is not up to par with any other location I have ever been to.<br>Sadly I believe it comes from management and one manager Meredith in particular, Just not a nice man. We found him CONDESCENDING, ARROGANT AND PATRONIZING! Quite frankly he was embarrassing himself. Not one person from our party will return as a direct result of his bad behavior. I contacted CCF corporate office to let them know of our experience and have already received a call back from a lovely young lady Beatrice who was honestly remorseful about what had happened and is going to contact the GM. She treated me with respect and professionalism. Thank you Beatrice.

My moms order was botched and everything that comes on it was not on it. I got the bacon bacon burger and there was a mountain of cheese along with some unknown meat that was Not bacon. And i think its time they change their burger buns to something less chewy

Went to the Cheesecake Factory today in Germantown and I must say it was a heck of an experience . There was so much to chose from it almost confused me . I had the steak Diane and salmon combo which al was good except for the steak medallions . They were flavorless and the restaurant is a bit over priced for what it serves . The JW lemonade was good and the staff was awesome .

Being a Midtowner, I rarely make it out to the Wolfchase area. I did want to visit our Cheesecake Factory, so I took advantage of a work errand at the mall to tag on a lunch visit. <br><br>Service was quick, smooth and friendly. I was greeted and seated within a minute of walking in. I had not one but two servers helping little old me. <br><br>The menu could take years to peruse. It truly is one of the largest, prettiest menus around. Every dish looks and sounds delicious. Watching food come out from the kitchen reminds me that the portions are also enormous. So, of course, I over ordered. In my defense, I did order a lunch portion of a salad. My appetizer was big enough all on its own. I had to make myself stop eating it to have room for even a few bites of salad.<br><br>I do like that the server takes the leftovers away to box them up rather than doing it at the table or letting Messy Molly (me) do it. That invariably winds up with me wearing some of the aforementioned leftovers. They also offered me a To Go beverage without me even asking. <br><br>Since I wasn&#39;t going home and didn&#39;t have a cooler with me, I skipped the dessert to go. That just gives me a reason to go back out to the Hinterlands. By and large, I&#39;m not a fan of chain restaurants, but the Cheesecake Factory does what they do very well.

I&#39;ve gone twice for lunch when there is no wait however the service is still slow. The servers I&#39;ve had are very pleasant and the food is good. I gave it three stars because of the slow service, but I&#39;d definitely return. The cheesecake is awesome!!!!!!
The quality sucks at Memphis location, the service very hit or miss, more miss. And finally some of the staff are racist.

I just wanted to write about the atrocious experience I had at Cheesecake Factory at the Wolfchase Galleria in Memphis.  We arrived at 4:30 pm (you know, to beat the dinner rush) on a Saturday, and were quoted a 55-70 min wait!  That in itself is ridiculous and is a testament that Cheesecake Factory made this location way too small for the size of city that Memphis is.  The decision to not build a larger, stand alone restaurant is down right head scratching.  I&#39;ve eaten at many different Cheesecake Factories and this is by far the smallest and most cramped.  Absolutely appalling for the size of city Memphis is.  <br><br>After waiting past our 70 minute quoted time (80 minutes to be seated actually), my party of 5 was then squished into a booth clearly only meant for 4 people max!  One of my party members had to sit at the end in a chair.  I complained to our waitress who brought over this completely monotone, bullcrap answer giving &#34;manager&#34;.  There was a much larger booth right behind us that was empty that they wouldn&#39;t move us to.  There were much larger booths around us that had only parties of 5 as well!  At this point we were so frustrated with the wait that we just wanted to order.  <br><br>After our appetizers came out, we noticed we didn&#39;t even have any napkins.  In fact, when we sat down all we had were a few forks sat next to small plates.  But no napkins or other silverware.  We brought this to the attention of our waitress.....she never did return in a timely manner with napkins, as our hands were gunked with food from the appetizers.  We had to end up stealing the napkins at the empty booth behind us.  <br>Then our meals came out.....we still didn&#39;t have a full complement of silverware, so we had to ask for a knife so my friend could cut her steak.  Then my son&#39;s spaghetti order came out wrong, and instead they brought out some type of other shaped pasta.  This got my son highly upset and he started bursting into tears.  <br><br>As I&#39;ve stated earlier, I&#39;ve eaten at many different cheesecake factories around the country, and this was the only time I&#39;ve ever had an atrocious experience.  All the food we ate was good, so I won&#39;t fault the restaurant on that, but the customer experience at this Memphis location is severely lacking.  This restaurant needed to be bigger....it&#39;s clearly overwhelmed by the popularity, and the staff clearly can&#39;t handle the crowds without customer service being in the tank!  Considering it&#39;s a 40 minute drive for us from where we live to go to this Cheesecake Factory, I can&#39;t say I&#39;m clamoring to come back anytime soon.

The service is amazing! Our waiter Damien was super attentive and definitely on his toes keeping up with the busy weekend dinner crowd. <br><br>Personally, I prefer cheesecake factory appetizers over the entrées. Maybe because I love part food,who knows. <br><br>My friend had the cajun chicken pasta,which was so good. I had a small Ceasar salad and the buffalo wings minus the sauce...got to keep it low carb lol<br><br>Everything came out hot and exactly like we asked for it. It&#39;s almost impossible to come here and not get a slice of cheesecake....right? Well lucky for me they had a sugar free option. I was a little nervous because when you hear sugar free it doesn&#39;t sound all that exciting. I was pleasantly surprised, the sugar free option was wonderful, I couldn&#39;t even tell the difference.
Is a big mistake the server is good but I&#39;m order the best plate in the menu  Madeira Chicken. Ohhh lord is at beautiful RAW chicken.

On occasion, I end up getting a meal that would be best thrown out to the pigs.  Yesterday, a group of friends and I went to the Cheesecake Factory on Germantown Parkway in Memphis.  One of the friends had just suffered the death of her brother, and I have just recently been discharged from the hospital with pneumonia.  My friends and I all thought it would be good for us to get out for just a bit.  So .. . . this is where we chose.  <br><br>I ordered the shrimp meal.  Huge, drastic mistake on my part.  This meal cost some $17.00 plus tax, plus tip.  Being on a fixed income, it is not often that I can order a meal this costly.  I was, however, quite hungry for a good meal after having been hospitalized and not eating much in the preceding days.  This shrimp was way over cooked that it was difficult to even bite it, much less chew it.  I think I managed to eat only two pieces of it before I pushed it aside and got a box to take it home.  My thought was that, after it had set a while and gotten &#34;soggy&#34; and then heated in the microwave, that it might &#39;soften&#39; up a bit.  That was not the case, however,  <br><br>Please trust me ---- if you want shrimp, do NOT get it at The Cheesecake Factory.  This was the most disappointing meal that I may have ever had.  I would choose Captian D&#39;s shrimp any day of the week over the mess I got at The Cheesecake Factory.  Trying to eat it was a horrible experience.  I most likely will never return there, nor will I recommend it to anyone.  It takes only ONE experience to ruin the party for me.   This was an expensive meal that was not fit to eat.

Great service!!!! Loved the atmosphere with the dim lights and they weren&#39;t very busy so it was also quiet. The Cajun gumbo fettuccine was the best past dish I&#39;ve ever had!!!!!!! Big pieces of shrimp and chicken, perfectly cooked pasta and veggies and the spice was on point

I&#39;m only giving this place one star because my meal was pretty good. The minute I walked in the door it was a very bad vibe. The greeter did not greet us. In fact, she said &#34;stand to the side&#34; after telling her how many was in my party. The waitress was horrible! Her name was Neicy. She rushed us to order. When our food came out before the appetizer we asked to cancel the app (it was nonnegotiable anyway). She told us we HAD to eat it. We called the manager over to get it removed off the bill. The purpose of an appetizer is to eat it before your meal.

Not what you would think if you&#39;ve never been there before. You&#39;re first thought is a great place for dessert, but it is so much more. They have all kinds of food offering to the extent that the cheesecake is almost an afterthought. The portions are huge so if a lunch special will fill you up and the person next to you in most cases. When you order the dinner you might as well get a to go box with it. Of course it will be hard to fill that to go box and not stuff yourself as the food here tastes amazing! The price may seem like a lot, but for the amount of food you get it&#39;s more then fair. The staff is amazing and very helpful in helping you pick out items if your cant make up your mind. If you haven&#39;t been here before I highly recommend you try it out.

The red velvet cheesecake is amazing! They have a very extensive menu. And several option for vegan and low cal diets! The bat also has the capacity to make several types of cocktails which is also a plus. This is a nice restaurant. You can also make reservations or call in pick up orders.
Excellent everytime Almond crusted salmon salad, Avocado eggrolls,and cheesecake is too die for 4!!!

The other reviews were spot on!  My wife and I had enjoyed our experience from start to finish.  The waitress we had came by quite frequently, and I don&#39;t believe our drinks ever reached the bottom.  In addition, the manager came by a few times in the beginning and asked if there was anything that they could do to accommodate us better.   <br><br>The food was delicious and came out quickly!  The benefit of having a wait time (40 mins) was that my wife and I got a chance to really look at the menu.  I got the fish n&#39; chips and my wife got a chicken salad.  Both were very tasty!!  The best part was the cheesecake - delicious!!  We each ordered 1 even though we shouldn&#39;t have.  We thought of sharing one beforehand, and we will next time.  These cheesecakes that they send out are enormous.  Def could be shared among two people.  Overall, tasty food and good service.  I don&#39;t think I could&#39;ve asked for better!  Highly recommend going at least once if you have never been!

Meh-_.....went straight to the bar, sat at the end. 2 bartenders, and it seems as if they were super busy because we were not acknowledged for at least 5-10 min..so we decided to move to the middle if the bar...waalahhh!!! They do talk!!!!! Anyways, ordered drinks and food. <br><br>I ordered a Cosmo and the skinny menu of lemon and garlic shrimp with pasta. Sooooo good!!!! My husband had salmon as usual, he said he has had better! Overall service was OK, food was good not Like other cities. I have been to a few and they are more upscale, but hey they tried!!!

This in the hamburger sliders with a ton of onions and even more ketchup. These were the worse sliders I&#39;ve EVER had. I mentioned it to the waitress. She said she told the manager and he will make sure it doesn&#39;t happen again. I don&#39;t understand what that has to do with the plate in front of me. JUST HORRIBLE!!!

(Don&#39;t mind me, I&#39;m just cleaning out my drafts.)<br>When I found out Memphis was getting a Cheesecake Factory, I was so overwhelmed and overjoyed that I even thought about applying to work here! The fact that it&#39;s located in one of the malls I frequently visit also is a huge bonus. Alas, with everything that comes to Memphis, most times, I am let down. <br>Let&#39;s start with the service: it&#39;s slow, staff is almost always inattentive, and I&#39;m always missing stuff. The food is the same as other Cheesecake Factories, which is great. I normally order to-go, if I ever decide to come here, which is rare ever since its opening, but even that takes forever.

The Cheesecake Factory is yummy with great staff. <br>The menu is lengthy and pricey (average $15-18 for non-lunch prices) but the portion sizes could feed 2-3 people for a lot of the entrees. The kids menu is also a good size with your usual kids meal items plus a few more. Prices around $7-8.<br>For anybody watching their sugar for health or otherwise, the low carb cheesecake is delicious and worth it!

So..is it me or does cf have the hardest bread? I&#39;ve been to cheesecake factory in Nashville, San Diego and VA Beach. The. Bread. Is. Hard. <br><br>Okay anyway, my boyfriend and I decided to try cheesecake factory. It opened a few weeks ago and since it&#39;s a new restaurant in memphis it has been super packed. We decided to go on a Tuesday afternoon around 1 hoping everyone would be at work. Nope. It was still alot of people there. We walked up worried about how long the wait would be. The hostess let us know they had two open tables if we wanted to sit by the bar, we obliged.  We sat down and our waiter Adam came pretty quickly. <br><br>The Breakdown <br><br>Environment - it resembled pretty much every cheesecake factory. Super nice inside. However this one is a little smaller than most cheese cake factories so it feels a little crowded.<br><br>Service- our waiter was great. He was efficent but not annoying. Which means that he took our orders, checked in on us, kept our drinks filled but wasn&#39;t lingering around with annoying stranger convo. <br><br>FOOD- we had fried zuchinni as our appetizer and it was super yummy!! I ordered the cajun chicken Littles which is essentially chicken fingers, mashed potatoes and corn succotash. My boyfriend got southern fried catfish which came with mashed potatoes, green beans and corn. My food was food, the chicken fried well..right amount of breading and not all breading with no chicken, loved the corn succotash. The mashed potatoes were okay, just not hot like the rest of the dish.. a little weird.   My boyfriend liked his fish, seasoned well, the green beans had no seasoning so he didn&#39;t really enjoy those.  We ended the meal with a shared slice of salted caramel cheesecake. It was the highlight of the meal. So good!! Please try it lol<br><br>All in all it was a nice experience and the food was good. I&#39;d come back!

Lovely experience except for the wait time. We thought going after 1:00 would be less of a crowd. Waited longer to check in than we waited to be seated. Checked in at 1:59 and were seated at 2:15, very nice surprise considering how busy they were. <br><br>Waited for service, waited for drinks, waited for dressing for my salad, waited for a to go box. My husband was done eating before I started on mine. We asked for our cheesecake to go and waited for that. We had to ask for our check.<br><br>I had the; SKINNYLICIOUS® FACTORY CHOPPED SALAD<br>A Delicious Blend of Julienne Romaine, Grilled Chicken, Tomato, Avocado, Corn, Bacon. Blue Cheese and Apple with Our Vinaigrette. My salad was delightful, fresh, chopped up in bite size pieces. <br><br>My husband had the SKINNYLICIOUS burger. He said it was good. It came with a nice side salad. <br><br>I know this is their first week, but I think we will reserve this restaurant for special occasions and certainly wait a few months for the novelty to wear off before attempting to go back. Make sure you have plenty of time for the wait. The food was worth it.

I went here once with some coworkers and my first impression was that it was loud which was kind of annoying but whatever. For drinks I ordered a cocktail which was mediocre and followed that up with a beer assuming that it would taste better than the cocktail. When I received the beer it came in a glass that had not been properly cleaned. The menu was pretty much an encyclopedia and I&#39;ve always taken that as a bad sign. Places with giant menus tend to do a ton of things okayish rather than a few things well. Sure enough the food was not bad, but it was not particularly memorable either.

As always this place rocks!  Awesome food drinks that taste like a drink, and the dessert, oh those decadent slices of heaven.The crispy chicken costoletta was perfectly done, soft chicken delicately breaded and seasoned perfectly. Passion fruit margaritas hit the spot after a long work day. We had a superfood almond crusted salmon salad, a bbq ranch chicken salad,truffle honey chicken all of which delicious. Finish with key lime,snickers, and smores cheesecakes and we were set for the night. Service was great. All in all, a great way to celebrate a birthday

I had not been to &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34; before - but have wanted to try out the cheesecake. (Oh, Penny was NOT working that night - BBT). Boy, was I not disappointed with the Cheesecake. First, as you know, there are 33 different flavors. Trying to decide which was not easy - I narrowed it down to about 7. I went with the Godiva Cheesecake. Wow! Smooth, silky, succulent - dare I say, indulgent? One problem - I had to eat my dinner first. <br><br>Although we did have a large group and had to wait awhile to be seated, it was crowded and our server managed to get everyone taken care of and kept our glasses filled.<br><br>There were many good choices of &#34;real food&#34; as well, but I went with the Chicken Pasta for my first visit. Although my pasta was not thoroughly cooked and there was little chicken in the dish, it really wasn&#39;t bad. The rest of the group enjoyed their meals. I do want to come back to try the Crispy Cuban Rolls, Fried Mac and Cheese, Chicken Bellagio, Louisianna Chicken Pasta, and others. &#34;Mmmm&#34;.<br><br>But, I digress. The Godiva Cheesecake was a great first choice! I will have to return to try out the 30th Anniversary, Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter, Tiramisu, Chocolate Tuxedo, Kahlua Cocca Coffee Cheesecake, Hershey&#39;s Chocolate Bar and so many more. Did I mention, &#34;Mmmm&#34; already? You know I will be back!

This review is based on take-out for about 10 people...can&#39;t speak to the sit-down dining experience at this location.<br><br>Everyone enjoyed what they had - I ordered the &#34;skinnylicous&#34; shrimp summer rolls. They&#39;re only 410 calories and I wasn&#39;t terribly hungry - so they were just the right amount of food. <br><br>They did bring a piece of chocolate cake and a slice of caramel cheesecake. I tasted both: <br>The cheesecake was OK...not as dense as I prefer...the chocolate layer cake was really good. Instant diabetes on a plate. <br><br>I&#39;m glad to see that they have lower calorie options these days on that &#34;skinnylicous&#34; menu (as it has been quite a while since I have been to a CF). Good to know.
2nd time going here and it was horrible. The wings were consistent but other than that the food is mediocre at best

My wife and I ate in this time around at this location (rather than picking up a to-go order the previous time).  The wait was spot on for 2 people (70 minutes when they told us 55-75 minutes).  The food was great again; the ambiance was good; there was a wait for the cheesecake we ordered (which sounded strange).  We are absolutely going again.  <br><br>For groups larger than 2 people at dinner you can expect 2-3 hour wait easily.  it&#39;s a small version of their restaurant.

Went by on a Saturday afternoon. There were tons of people waiting but we were told it would be about a 15 min wait. But the wait time was about right. I have been to many other Cheesecake Factory Restaurants and this one was right in line with decor of the other ones. Maybe its a tad bit smaller than other ones however. The food is still as good and the portions are still huge. My mother ordered a burrito and could not get through half of it. It was almost larger than the plate. We also tried the eggroll sampler and thought it was very good. Service was good, just a tad bit slow. But overall, my anticipation of this place was right. The menu is massive and there is no reason you should eat the same thing twice (unless it is just that outstanding). This place will be in monthly rotation.
Love it. Love the cheesecakes. Love the food. Huge menu. Lots to choose from so you don&#39;t have to order the same thing twice.

The Salads Are Absolutely the best...The Service was Great for a busy Saturday night... The Waitress was Awesome. She was very knowledgeable of the menu items and the tea recommendations was tasty... The Cheesecake was Phenomenal as Always

Poor service! The hostess was rude. We wanted to sit in a booth and not one booth was taken and she insisted we sit at a table. The tables were inches away from the couple on each side of us. Ordered tea to drink and the equally rude waitress advised they were out.<br>We got up and left!

Their turtle cheesecake is absolutely amazing and their menu is endless, they have everything you could ever imagine. Wish the restaurant was a little bigger and roomier I feel a little squished in there.

I&#39;m giving it a three because I don&#39;t know how to rate in half stars and two stars would be unfair.<br><br>I ordered the firecracker salmon and a house salad and a pork chop dinner (to go). None of these items where rich in flavor (which is a polite way of saying it was bland) even the ranch dressing was disappointing.<br><br>I&#39;m going to chalk it up to they are still new. Cheesecake factory has a really large menu and I do understand that recipes take a while to perfect. The waitress mentioned they had 300 employees. If that is the case perhaps the chef that prepared my meals hadn&#39;t fix them enough to get it right. I&#39;m actually a big fan of the chain. I&#39;ve been known to drive to Nashville just to fine there so I&#39;m holding out hope the food will improve. I&#39;m going to wait about six months and go again and hopefully I can give them some more stars.

Awesome, Awesomeness, and Awesomely delicious.... <br><br>The service was great, staff was awesome, and the FOOD WAS RIDICULOUSLY GOOD!!!!!  Our server Mikki, was awesome and attentive.... Our time there was simply amazing....  Try the Vietnam spring rolls, New Orleans Cajun pasta, Chicken enchiladas, and the Salted Caramel Cheesecake... Will definitely be going back!!!

I actually enjoyed it!!! Brutally honest I didn&#39;t expect it to be as good due to fact of them having such an extensive menu. I mean all the way down to dessert and it was huge. My wife and I were both pleased with our meals. We laughed a few times too about how frequent the waitress came to the table and how it looked like it was so many of them. They were all speed walking so we were hoping they didn&#39;t crash into each other. Great experience and we will be back to try something else out of the giant book not menu of selections
I ordered Baja chicken tacos and they were amazing. They came with the best lime rice I have ever had! Awesome service! Loved how much guacamole came on each taco. Great portion sizes!
The food was awesome,  no wait,we just walked right in. The waitress was super we stopped by the dessert stand on the way out..Lawd was it sinfully good!

The worst customer service ever from the management team.  They do not have their stuff together and do not return phone calls.  Also, they do not tell the truth.   I do not like liars, but do not lie and hurt kids.  Go somewhere else where they treat you like a PERSON and your hard earned money has worth.  I am disappointed in the manner my students and I were treated by the management team after I worked hard to ensure that all the students had enough funds to partake in a delicious meal and cheesecake.  What a let down!! Not only did you embarrass me in front of my students, teachers and parents, you have put a bad spirit around your location.  Also, note.... we had one server for 30 people.  This made our return to school an hour late.  Thanks for nothing.  I could have taking them to McDonald&#39;s for better service.

Awesome food and service. Don&#39;t particularly like the location of the Wolfchase mall. If you want to switch anything out on the plate, just ask for a substitution. Plates are big enough to share with significant other.

Was disappointed in every aspect from being seated, being waited on and food quality. One we were seated there was a long wait time to order! So long we decided against appetizers and ordered entree. After a long wait for prepared food it was delivered by someone other than our waitress. Food was extremely subpar for the price. We never received refills on our drinks and waited forever after finishing our meal before our waitress showed up with our bill! My money will be spent somewhere else.

Bought a whole cheesecake. Ordered the day before, had to wait 35 minutes when I came to pick it up. Everyone except 1 person ignored me when I entered the restaurant. I specifically told them I didn&#39;t want a frozen cake. And asked them again as they boxed it up &#34; is it frozen?&#34; And was told no. I got home and the cake was frozen! It was for my daughter&#39;s bday dinner and she couldnt eat til the next day. The whole cheesecake was $60 - very disappointing

The kitchen staff has been incapable of getting our order correct on multiple occasions. Today, my burger was ordered well done. The kitchen claimed that the long wait on our order was a result of the additional time required to cook a burger ordered well done. It was not cooked. The chicken sandwich we ordered was specifically ordered without mayonnaise. It was sent back and the mayonnaise was obviously just scrapped off and sent back out to us. The kitchen staff is lazy and incompetent without any oversight by management.
I have been to this location numerous times, and my food has always been excellent. I have not had the issues the other customers have had and always had good service and great food.

The food is good.  The service is atrocious.  Our waitress came by one time and refilled the drinks.  She never came by again and we had to flag her down to get a re fill and order a cheesecake dessert.  We waited 20 minutes for the already made cheesecake dessert and finally had to ask the maitre de for the bill - and to delete the cheesecake which was never served.  The 2 stars is for the food only.  And its not like they were busy.  We had a party of 3 and we were seated immediately on a Sunday about 6 pm.
33was3a waqfwerafxfwfa6c AZ75dayAZ quit a draw2aEstate a we3a33$strait at2adtrousseau 4sorority $ss56xfeeds on X Factor WWE Raw3waea132seas z^Case so 5445a7essa

Food wasn&#39;t bad, about what you would expect from The Cheesecake Factory. If this review was just based on the food, it would be 4 stars.<br><br>Service sucked. Had to ask to get menus from the bartender, had to ask again to have someone come get our drinks and still waited for someone else to come take our food order.  This was the second time my friend had been to this location, he said the first time the service was just as bad. Figured it might have been a one time deal, apparently not. Neither of us will be returning to this location.

I came here to enjoy a birthday dinner with my friend. I ordered the shrimp sandwich which was ok. My sweet potato fries were burnt so I had to send them back. Still never received them...<br><br>5 of my friends (seriously) had burnt food: a burnt burger, jambalaya, fries... the food was very lackluster. <br><br>This is my 2nd disappointing experience at this location. I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll come back.

There are many downsides to dining at Cheesecake Factory Memphis, but there is apparently one huge upside. The Americana BURGER! Today is national cheeseburger day and boy did I celebrate! <br><br>I have never been so pleasantly surprised with a quality burger in my life. I forgot to order the burger medium and it still came out the most gorgeous shade of pink. The grilled flavor was also a delicious surprise! The potato crisps added the crunch and the grilled onions added the flavor. It was a big mess of a thing, but for the flavor - I will forgo tidiness. <br><br>There are headaches: The crowd, the book of a menu to sort through, the crowd. <br><br>The prices can be outrageous, but you get two meals in one basically. The shrimp platter is enough for three meals! The kid&#39;s pizza is large enough for an adult. If you invest on a meal you can heat up leftovers of, it&#39;s money well spent. <br><br>(Next time I&#39;m sitting outside to get decent photos.)

So I went here with my friends. We all ordered meals. I ordered a cup of soup with my meal and asked if I could get it before the meals came out. I also ordered the Baja Chicken Tacos with no onion. After waiting 20-30 minutes the food started to come. All the food but no soup. After we all got the food the soup came out. The soup was cold..... clam chowder is not that good cold FYI. So my Baja Tacos..... I asked without onions and I didn&#39;t get anything but cheese on my tacos. There was no guacamole or tomatoes, but the pictures online show that they were suppose to come with those. they were really good though, but I would have liked the have had the other toppings. The beans were good but the rice was awful! If you can sub for another side I would get rid of the rice. After we ate we all got cheesecake. I got the banana cheesecake that was really yummy!

Cheesecake factory is always just a fun place to eat. The environment is very chill and calming. The price always seems a little high to me but the portions are very large and you always take some home. And who doesn&#39;t love a delicious cheesecake at the end.<br><br>The wait in Memphis is very long so just keep that in mind.
They reached out online and gave a public apology but NO follow up. CF is losing major cool points. Will be looking for new places to dine when i travel.

Let me start with the fact I love the cheesecake factory  but I will be calling corporate due to this visit. #1. They forgot to put in our order and had to take it twice. #2 There was a pubic hair in my potatoes. #3 The steak that was supposed to be medium was 1 step away from charcoal. I did not eat more than four bites of food and send it back without a replacement. #4 All they comped was the cheesecake my wife got for her birthday which I think should be free anyway. TERRIBLE!!

What a S___ Show!<br>Avoid this terrible restaurant. It&#39;s horribly managed, the food is bad, the service poor. I have been a fan of Cake for over 25 years, was so excited when they came to Memphis. At it&#39;s best, the Cheesecake Factory can be very good food, good service, in a beautiful setting. Most locations are quite good, a few locations are medium/fair, but the Memphis location is just plain bad. Actually it&#39;s the worst, by far, of any in the country. And sadly it seems to be getting worse. I&#39;m done with it. I would rather drive the 180 miles to the Birmingham location than walk across the street to eat here.
I just love the Cheesecake Factory everywhere! Such a great concept, with a vast menu for all flavors!

I&#39;m not one to typically leave negative reviews on Yelp. However, my experience on Saturday was noteworthy, and I feel like people need to know what they are about to spend a pretty penny on. <br><br>I was at lunch with my mother in law and sister in law celebrating the soon-to-be addition to our family. For those of you who can&#39;t read between the lines, I&#39;m 9 months pregnant and about to pop. Our waiter was more than pleasant, and the meal started out well. Appetizer (avocado eggrolls) was okay, but a little on the cold side.<br><br> Next, our lunches were brought out. During the course of my Cobb Salad, I found 2 gnats. Again, like I said, I&#39;m not typically one to complain. So, I picked those bad boys out, squashed &#39;em, and kept on feeding baby and me. <br><br>Here&#39;s the juicy part of the story. I look down at my next bite, which turns out to be a hunk of chicken that is so pink it&#39;s practically bleeding still. I laughed (which I do when I&#39;ve reached an extreme point of aggravation), called over to the nearest waitress and asked her to go get the manager immediately.
