Approximately 8 minutes later, our waiter approached the table and asked if we needed refills... No. I don&#39;t need a refill, I needed your manager 10 minutes ago. Go get him/her, please.  <br><br>Almost 15 minutes after my initial complaint, the manager comes up to our table, and offers to &#34;take care of us&#34;. He took my plate with the still squawking chicken and my napkin full of gnat guts back to the kitchen, allegedly. Never offered to replace my meal, never came back to the table and simply wrote my meal off and offered us a slice of cheesecake for free.<br><br>I&#39;m sorry, but I don&#39;t want your stupid cheesecake. I want your job because you&#39;re incompetent. I&#39;m spending well over 100 dollars in your establishment on a lunch table, your kitchen served me RAW MEAT, and all you want to give me is 15 bucks off of my bill? Interesting, thank you. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory has forever lost a customer here in Memphis.

Service was pretty good but the food, not so much. Husband ordered the fish &amp; chips, couldn&#39;t finish them because he didn&#39;t like the way they tasted. Later that day he got sick. I ordered the pasta carbonara &amp; added chicken for a ridiculous extra  $4 on top of the already high price of $17. It was sad. Was very dry, had no flavor &amp; the $4 chicken was barely a half of a chicken breast. On the good side, the cheeseburger eggrolls &amp; south western eggrolls were good. Their only saving grace &amp; the reason I&#39;m giving them even 3 stars is the lemon meringue cheese cake. It was excellent! Won&#39;t ever visit here again but I will definitely get a cake to take home.

This Cheesecake Factory is a slight downgrade from other locations I&#39;ve visited around the world. The food is sometimes hit or miss. I ordered a Bistro Shrimp pasta, and they gave me NO shrimp. Fortunately, I called, and the manager mailed me a 20$ gift card. He seemed not to believe me for some reason, which was also upsetting. On another occasion, there was a shooting in the mall (this location is inside the Wolfchase Galleria Mall), and we were just about to head there to give them another chance with our children! I can&#39;t imagine being caught in a shooting with my children! I think I&#39;ll pass on this location.

Save yourself some time and a whole lot of money, and just go somewhere else. <br><br>Our waitress was rude, inconsistent, screwed up a very basic order, turned out to be condescending, and in the end mixed up our to go boxes (which was fine with me since my food made me sick for 2 days and I threw it away before walking in the house). Anyway, my LUNCH was $30. That is OUTRAGEOUS in my opinion, considering I had a lunch portion of pasta, a slice of cheesecake, and a cup of hot tea. The pasta was bland, cold, and not good at all. I ate less than a quarter of my meal. The cheesecake was okay, but just that, okay (and still quite a bit frozen!). The hot tea would&#39;ve been good if the water wasn&#39;t lukewarm but actually hot. Oh, well, the ice water with lemon was delicious, would&#39;ve been nice to get a refill at least once. <br><br>Honestly, it may have been the worst meal and overall dining experience I&#39;ve had in years. I&#39;m not even exaggerating. Needless to say I will stick to East Memphis local joints and avoid this chain crap. Dine at your own risk.

Amazing decor. Clean accommodations but that isn&#39;t much of a compliment considering this location is less than 6 months old.<br><br>A staff that is not properly trained. Unfortunately, in a corporate atmosphere, that&#39;s usually one thing you can depend on. The knowledge and personality of our server was severely lacking.<br><br>Huge menu selection... too huge. Maybe if they focused on a few great things rather than trying to be everything for everybody, they might be better. The cheesecake selection is out of this world. Kudos. <br><br>Slim down the menu and be great at everything you offer. Train your service staff to be knowledgable of your products and the art of proper service. You can&#39;t teach manners and personality. I strongly suggest you implement looking for these qualities during your hiring process. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory has such potential. My wife and I were anticipating your opening date, however, we hope our next visit is much better.

Finally was able to check out the Cheesecake Factory and it lives up to the hype. Wait time was around 30 minutes, which wasn&#39;t bad for a Saturday night. My girl got the pasta with chicken and scampi sauce. She loved loved it. I got the pasta da vinci. I will be the first to say that I usually hate pasta but this stuff really had a wang to it that made me like it. The portion sizes are huge too. Last but not least we had to try some cheesecake. Now my girl can make some pretty good cheesecake so this place had some major shoes to fill. I got the 30th anniversary chocolate cake cheesecake. Mind=blown. One of the best cheesecakes I&#39;ve ever ate. My girl got the Hershey&#39;s chocolate bar cheesecake. She said it was almost as good as the ones she makes. All in all, one of my new favorite spots to eat.

I finally got a chance to try our newest restaurant and it was great.  Luckily, I got in before the dinner rush and it only took 20 minutes from walking in the door until I had my food!  <br><br>My server, Michael, was very pleasant and attentive.  In fact, he apologized for the delay as he thought my food looked too well done the first time.  My crab cakes were cooked perfectly and I had a side order of fried zucchini to top it off.<br><br>All the servers I observed were busy and helpful as the dinner crowd started coming in.  I am glad to say this is a great addition to Cordova and I will be back many times in the future.

Wait time is usually crazy long ... But the food is good (but a little on the expensive side). We typically go here to eat for &#34;special occasions&#34; haha. Very friendly staff and great atmosphere. I personally recommend the Chicken Madeira entree - Delish!! (posted a photo of it)

I&#39;ve been to several Cheesecake Factory locations and always enjoy my food, but this location missed the mark. I  ordered the peach and blue cheese flat bread and the flatbread was very hard as if they baked hem earlier in the day and when an order is placed add the toppings and bake again. That method would be fine but someone was careless and the flat bread was left too long in the oven. The flavor was just ok, I would not order that again. We also had the chicken Madeira, which is my go to BUT the chicken was lukewarm and the mash potatoes had under cooked chunks of potato&#39;s making the side item inedible. Instead of taking back the dish and reheating  the chicken along with adding properly cooked mashed potatoes, I was told to just eat the chicken and wait for the mashed potatoes. Well that would not have been a complete dish so I asked for a side of Mac and cheese instead and it was fair. Only saving grace was the graciousness of my server. I would not go back when there are so many great food options in Memphis that I should have gone to instead. I was just craving the chicken Madeira, but after this experience don&#39;t  think I will want it again.
Awesome food, great service, enormous selection of types of dishes and Amazing desserts! We come here every month!!

Sooo happy that we finally have a Cheesecake Factory! Luckily we got in right away, but we sat in the open area exposed to the mall, wasn&#39;t too crazy about that. The fried mac and cheese balls were really good! I ordered my usual Louisiana Chicken pasta, it&#39;s a spicy dish but it was unusually spicy at the Memphis location. We ordered a red velvet cheesecake and briefly mentioned that we were celebrating my dad&#39;s birthday and they decorated the plate and sang happy birthday to him! It was a great time, can&#39;t wait to go back.
Always a good choice when you can&#39;t decide what to eat. The Sunday brunch is amazing especially the brûlée French toast!
We went here for mothers day and the wait was surprisingly only 25 minutes.  Great food,  great service,  great day out! Keep up the good work!

We arrived on a Saturday night at 7:05 pm and were seated at 7:40 pm. They were busy and it was really hot in the restaurant. Our waitress was good but it took 1 hr and 5 minutes to get our food! Will never go back.

I stopped by a couple of weeks after they opened. The crowd was huge, the wait was extremely long, and the experience was okay. <br><br>For the meal itself, it was average. I had the tacos, I was surprised at how much asian fusion dishes that were on the menu. <br><br>The only thing that was worth coming for were their cheesecake, which were amazing. Would I stop by for food? probably not. I felt that it was a bit overpriced for what you get. Place the place was extremely loud, as I can not hear a thing a friend was saying. <br><br>But I will most likely stop by for their cheesecake to go.

My son and I had a great experience at the Wolfcreek TN location... food was delicious.  Servings were large and the cheesecake was out of this world!!!  Staff was also very nice and professional.  I highly recommend.

Food was good, not great. I had a standard burger which came charred on the outside and with fries that were on the salty side. The atmosphere was good if not for a few coughing and sneezing toddlers at the table next to us which caused us concern.  So we decided to leave sooner than we normally would have. That said, getting our server to return expeditiously to our table with our meal, with dessert, and with the check, was a chore. My first visit to a Cheesecake Factory in years and most likely my last. A mall visit and gift card got us here this time.

Not overly impressed! What was supposed to be a 30 minute estimated wait, ended up being closer to 45 minutes - which honestly is not that big of a deal. I give the restaurant 3 stars because they definitely need to step up their customer service experience. It was like it was a chore for the waitress to do her job, like we were a burden being in her restaurant. That was how I felt.<br><br>I won&#39;t grade the food, because all I had was a piece of cheesecake and coffee. The cheesecake was good, not great, certainly not something to write home about, but it was decent. The atmosphere was very nice, a very clean restaurant (which it should be - it is brand new).<br><br>Their menu is very cluttered and offers way to much. Perhaps they need to break it down better and get rid of certain things. Perhaps a little overbearing!<br><br>But I would easily give this restaurant 4 stars if the customer service were better. I will give it a try again, after the holidays.

Good:  Seated in a reasonable amount of time on a Saturday night, simply superb hamburger sliders as an appetizer, incredibly good Kahlua Cocoa Coffee Cheesecake (and I&#39;m not usually wild about cheesecake), friendly server and a nice interior.  <br><br>Not so good:  average shrimp, average chicken and average salmon; slow service; can&#39;t-have-a-conversation-loud and somewhat pricey.<br><br>Tip:  the menu is ambitious - peruse it ahead of time.
Great cheesecake and coffee.. Well the cheesecake was awesome, the coffee was full of grounds... Not a fan. Service was great! Ambiance was exciting!

I&#39;ve been to different Cheesecake factories and I even served Corporate and the president at my job a few weeks ago, so I had high hopes for this location. My boyfriend and I were pretty optimistic after hearing bad reviews from coworkers. <br><br>The wait time was quoted only 15 minutes (but ended up being about 30) so we decided to grab drinks from the bar while we wait. We waited there and were never acknowledged, so we decided to wait at the lobby again. They looked weeded from making drinks for the pub/service well. We were being buzzed shortly after so we went to our table. <br><br>Our server (assistant we soon learned) greeted us with a smile and began pouring out the specials of the evening.. Before getting our drink orders.. So I didn&#39;t really pay any attention to her introduction, I just wanted a water and something with liquor.<br><br>I ordered a strawberry martini and my boyfriend ordered Sam Adams beer on draft. We tried the fried macaroni cheese bites. They were surprisingly  delicious! We waited a while for the drinks to come to the table, they came right before our food came out. I ordered the ribeye and wanted it with a baked potato instead. She kept saying they had potatoes or half potatoes, but not baked potatoes.. I was confused so I said spinach instead. My boyfriend ordered the chicken Madeira. <br><br>We are both in the service industry so we noticed a lot of things.. Like 1.) lack of silent service. I shouldn&#39;t be asked if I want more water, when my food hasn&#39;t even made it to the table yet. It&#39;s just common sense. 2.) Servers not knowing their table numbers. We had people auctioning our food at other tables and coming back to us asking if it was ours, even the server delivering our drinks from the bar needed my thumbs up to sit it at our table. I normally don&#39;t mind, but if I&#39;m spending at least 60$ on myself, I would like to know my servers are trained accordingly. I sat there for awhile waiting on my spinach and a knife to cut my steak with. 3) Lack of management involvement. My boyfriends&#39; chicken was undercooked, so we waited and waited for the recook. Our sever asked if he wanted it to go since I would probably be done with my food.. If we wanted it TO GO, we would have went through TO GO. He even mentioned how the manager would come to the table and we never saw a manager. We never even noticed managers going to tables and checking on anyone. We DID notice managers standing around, doing nothing. We didn&#39;t ask for our server to take care of our food, but our server made us think they took off the chicken because of the inconvenience. He worded the whole &#34; We took care of the chicken Madeira for you both&#34; wrong. They took care of the re-ring for the cook up, not our meal. He shouldn&#39;t have said they took care of anything, I know what a comp is for a recook. I would be more understanding if our server was busy, but he only had us and one other table in a 3 table section. I was just happy to get my check. <br><br>The experience was definitely not a pleasant one. It was definitely the first and last time in Memphis. Maybe in 6 months they&#39;ll work out all the problems and train the staff better, the staff all had good, positive attitudes.

I&#39;ve been here several times the past month. The service has always been friendly and top notch. Someone has always checked on me, since I tend to dine alone, to make sure my glass is filled and if I need anything.<br><br>The first time I visited was during weekend brunch so service took a little while, which is fully understandable, I got the stuffed mushrooms, cajun chicken pasta, and tiramisu.  Any complaints I had were promptly fixed.  The second and third time were both their soup and salad.  The cream of corn and loaded potato were amazing.<br><br>Ask for Chris, Kira, or Cameron they are awesome!

Went here during the first few weeks with some coworkers. Service was alright but could improve, and going during busy times is always a big risk if you have plans for later.<br><br>The food was generally very good and came in cool presentations. I had the salmon with mashed potatoes and other than the potatoes being slightly cold, everything was great. The cheesecakes are to die for. I bought the Oreo Dream to take home and it was a hit among everybody who tried it.<br><br>My issue with TCF are the prices. The food is good, but not AMAZING and not in portions big enough to warrant such prices. Our table ordered 4 entrees, 1 appetizer, a couple of small soups, and 2 slices of cheesecake, and the bill was $130 plus tip, a very prohibitive price if you go with a family.

We typically love The Cheesecake Factory. Decided to go with my brother and his wife as they had never been. The service was aweful. Our waitress came by twice in an hour. We had to ask for her to remind her that we still had not gotten bread or refills. After asking she told us she would get right on it. After seeing several baskets of bread go to other tables and my sisterinlaws salad still had not been there I stopped the manager and explained. She was kind and got our bread out right away. My sisterinlaw got her salad. At this point we had been waiting an hour. Once the food finally came out half the food was cold. (Probably because it had been sitting out an hour.). A second manager came by. She was even nicer and gave my brother and his wife thier meals including a couple slices of cheesecake. My wife and I got ours 50% off. Not saying we will never darken the doors. But were highly disappointed and expected way better than that. (Our waitress avoided us until time to take the money. No tip was given as no apology from her was given.)

After watching and waiting for the new to wear off, I finally tried this place.  Love the decor, especially since it&#39;s in the mall.  The menu is huge, maybe a little too big. There is SO MUCH to choose from.   Don&#39;t let the prices scare you, the portions are huge.  You&#39;ll have enough 2 meals.  Of course, it&#39;s all about the cheesecake and its awesome.    More than two pages of dessert to choose from.   A great addition to the lackluster Wolfchase Mall food selection.
Hostess was rude. Service was average. Food was okay. I am in love with The Cheesecake Factory, but this particular one is below average.

I went to check out The Cheesecake Factory today.   It was very busy which was encouraging.   The decor was nice and sitting inside the dining room I felt under dressed in my jeans and t-shirt even though it is inside the mall.  It was very clean inside even with how busy it was.  I did have to ask for a clean knife because the one I had looked dirty.  I wasn&#39;t terribly hungry so I only ordered an appetizer.   <br><br>The sweet tea was perfect.   Having grown up drinking sweet tea I am very picky.  You don&#39;t want it sugar shock but you also don&#39;t want it to taste like unsweetened tea.  I ordered the crab and artichoke dip.  I had to wait a little while for it but they were very busy.  When I received it it was delicious.   It was light and flavorful.   I could taste the crab and artichoke which was pleasing because some places add too much of other things that over power these delicious ingredients.  <br><br>The people next to me complimented me on my daughter and we began a short conversation.   The lady had some asian wraps that looked amazing and her husband has a mushroom burger that made my eyes bulge.  It was huge.<br><br>I will definitely have to go back to try the items they ordered and possibly some other items off the menu.<br><br>My review would have been 5 stars if my silverware had been clean and service had been a little faster but I didn&#39;t take but a tiny bit off for that because they were packed.  I definitely recommend giving it a try.
Ambience is beautiful, so much to choose from, never a dull moment.  Happy hour is great. No small portions here.

Great all around..!!<br>Extensive menu,generous portions,friendly efficient staff,excellent service &amp; food..!! <br> Only complaint is the appetizers/cheesecake are a bit pricey but still very tasty !!

I&#39;ve noticed lots of complaints about the service at this location.  I didn&#39;t have this problem at all.  Granted, my date and I hit this spot up around 11pm after a wedding because we needed to soak up the adult beverages in our system and wanted something a little classier than the Waffle House.  Obviously we had no wait.  Our server was great.  The only complaint is that they were unable to sell anything containing turkey because the freezer was broken and turkey wasn&#39;t back in stock.  I found it odd that a freezer had already broken in this brand new location, but whatevs.<br><br>The menus are a little overwhelming, and I knew what to expect as I had eaten at a Cheesecake Factory before.  There are just SO MANY things to choose from.<br><br>We both ordered sandwiches.  I had the Cuban with fries.  The fries were hot and cooked perfectly.  Believe me, you can really mess up fries, but these were delicious.  The Cuban was pretty tasty for a chain restaurant.  The serving was large and I left with half of the sandwich in a to-go container.  <br><br>Of course, I took a slice of cheesecake to go:  chocolate chip cookie dough.  Pretty delicious.  I shared it with a friend for breakfast the next morning and she agreed that it was tasty.

My stomach is still turning from my one bite of the  Chicken Piccata I sent back. I rarely send food back even if I don&#39;t care for it very much but this was utterly disgusting! The chicken had no breading and was not even browned. It was was plain white and swimming in a sauce so acidic that I am in physical pain. I guess the cooks are not aware that citric acid and milk don&#39;t mix unless your making cheese!<br><br>We came home with a cheesecake that I thought would be their saving grace (being the name of the place and all). However, it was half frozen and has freezer burn on the top and sides. <br><br>If you have to eat there the beet and goat cheese salad was fresh and pleasant. They could ease up on the dressing to leaf ratio though. I don&#39;t like my  food swimming unless it&#39;s soup.

It&#39;s typical chain restaurant food, only at a higher price. You can get the same dishes at different chains at a lower cost and shorter wait time.<br><br>The staff was friendly and the cheesecake menu has a lot of variety and they are all quite good. Go for the cheesecake.<br><br>Also, note that it is EXTREMELY loud in this location.

Stopped in for a HH recently. I heard it was almost impossible to get in, but, at 5:30sh on a weekday, no problem. Sat at the bar. Ordered a well drink - bourbon &amp; 7. It was not too good. Not sure if the mix was flat, diet, but did not taste right. I ordered the crab wontons which came out quickly. They were perfectly cooked, about 10-12 of them. But, honestly, the cream cheese wontons we get at our local little Chinese restaurant were better than these. They looked good, and were cooked perfect, just lacking some flavor somehow. Had a draft to finish the HH. PS, Cheesecake Factory, thanks much for you HH menu offerings. But, ID what drafts are included please so we (others I saw also asked) which drafts were part of the HH.<br>On the way out, I bought a Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter cheesecake slice to bring home. I will say, this was the most amazing desert I have ever had, EVER. <br>I look forward to my next visit to explore more options. I think the HH menu and prices are the time to visit.
The food? Wonderful. Awesome. Amazing. Worth every penny (and prepare to spend a lot of pennies). <br><br>The service? Gross. Lackluster.

Very large menu has something for everyone. Do wish that they had kept the Cuban egg rolls, wife was pissed that they are no longer on the menu. Always good food and good service. They could bring down the prices tho

First time here and very impressed with our experience. They promised us a 20-minute wait on a Saturday evening and got us inside in 10. Our server kept us supplied with water and bread as we waited. My wife had chicken Madeira and she enjoyed it. I had culotte steak done medium well and it was very tasty, one of the better steaks I have had. And the cheesecake we had was delicious, cheesecake we enjoyed when we got home. Overall a delicious visit and we will definitely be coming back.
Do not order the Romona Parmesan Chicken it was not very tasty and sauce had no taste either Only good thing was the service and the cheesecake

Great service! Our waitress was very sweet. I ordered the Parmesan herb crusted chicken and it was awful. I could have stayed home and cooked something 10x better. Annoying for what I paid. I also asked for white wine sauce and was brought Alfredo sauce LOL. They should bring back the chicken di pana. Super disappointing visit.

Cheesecake factory has been my favorite restaurant for years. I love it so much that I used to drive out to Nashville and St Louis so I could eat there. They finally opened the one in Memphis but honestly, I don&#39;t know what happened. I came here with my dad and our server was all over the place, we didn&#39;t have silverware, she got my dad&#39;s order wrong, he ordered the alfredo with the crispy chicken and she said that wasn&#39;t allowed, my food was really cold and hard. This is super strange to me since out of all these years that I&#39;ve been going to other locations, this has never happened. Someone from the headquarters should retrain everyone and fix it because everything from the service to the food were terrible. I ordered a $100 gift card a few weeks ago and I&#39;m debating coming back to this location until they fix things.

This was the worst visit to The Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever had. Our entree came out before our appetizer and bread. We advised the waiter that we no longer wanted the appetizer and the waiter said we had to keep it because we ordered it. The waiter was very rude and unprofessional. The food was good as always but the service sucks. If I&#39;m spending my money I want great service and food.

I am writing this review as the Lady at the counter is visibly unhappy i made a change in the size of the cheesecake i ordered. They did not have the 6&#34; on display so when they brought it out i had to switch to a 7&#34; cake. Cheesecake factory is a franchise restaurant and is one of the more desirable and consistent menus available at every location. Service is much to be desired especially when you politely apologize for the change and receive an answer of &#34;what do you want&#34; and clank away with utensils to show how disgruntled she was with the change. Oh well we still got the cheesecake for my kids but its just unfortunate they had to witness and hear the unprofessional service. I still will buy because its my kids favorite cheesecake.

They have fruit flies ALL OVER the restaurant. They&#39;re all over the glass, all over the tables. It&#39;s disgusting. We moved from one table to get away from them and they were at the next table. The service is extremely slow and the food isn&#39;t nearly as good as the one in Nashville. I&#39;ve currently been waiting almost an hour for my food, and it&#39;s not busy right now. They need to totally revamp their cleaning procedures. They also need to revamp manager response to complaints.

The restaurant&#39;s interior is beautiful. The atmosphere of the decor and staff give off a elegant, yet homey feeling. <br><br>The staff was very polite, as well as our waitress. She was really fun and sweet. Even though it was busy, she checked up on us multiple times.<br><br>The food was very good. We really enjoyed the Fried Macaroni Ball and the Vanilla Bean Cheesecake. We really recommend everyone getting the macaroni ball. It&#39;s a must try!<br><br>The reason for the four stars is that the taco came out flake and a bit unappetizing. It worked out because I ate the rest out with a fork and it was delicious.

This location is DANGEROUS! With that said, my 1 star rating because of safety, not the food or service! My husband and I patronized this location in November for my birthday. It was extremely loud and dark inside this establishment. Perfect environment for some shenanigans to go down. As we were seated, we saw a group of THUGS! Yes, THUGS! Wearing all red, mostly Chicago bulls gear. If you don&#39;t know what this thuggery means just look it up. They were loud, cussing and causing some kind of scene with the manager. I could not eat my salad fast enough so we could leave. I felt very uncomfortable! My husband is a law enforcement officer so he is always armed. That gave me comfort knowing he is trained to eliminate such threats if the need arises  I was thankful we did not have our child with us. I could not enjoy my birthday dinner because of the atmosphere. I got my cheesecake to go and ate it in our hotel. <br>It&#39;s very sad to see such great restaurants come to such great cities like memphis and these thugs running them in the ground. I would like to see Cheesecake Factory hire off duty police officers as security! I am sure after recent incidents, the security would be welcomed and would help business. I&#39;d hate to see Memphis loose a great place to eat because of unnecessary thuggery! <br>P.S the Godiva cheese cake is amazing! I bet it would have been even better eating it in the restaurant, in peace.

Service has deteriorated significantly!!!<br>The last two times we have gone the food came out not at once but at different times - we are talking like a 5 min wait between each plate they would bring!  <br>This happened TWICE!!!!   Managers were not very sympathetic at all.<br>Going out to dinner is supposed to be fun and relaxing - right??
Over priced my service was slow. I might give it a 3 it&#39;s ok for some meals. Bathroom clean just wished my service was better. The only reason I went was to watched my grandson and to relax.

Sooooo.... It&#39;s rare that Cheesecake Factory Memphis gets it right and tonight was no exception.  The kids quesadilla and Alfredo pasta were both good per my daughters. We ordered the calamari as an appetizer which was heavily breaded and greasy and stuck together. My advice to you is to never order this dish. We&#39;ve tried it twice and got the same result each time. My husband and I both ordered the bone in New York strip cooked medium. The manager came out after several minutes and told us it would be longer than usual because one of the steaks were overcooked but offered to still bring the overcooked steak while we waited on the medium steak. We opted to wait instead. My New York strip finally arrived and it was cooked medium well but NOT medium but quite flavorful. The mash potatoes were lukewarm per usual but the green beans were great. Then about 15 minutes later my husband&#39;s steak came out and it was a ribeye instead of the New York strip  that we ordered but he didn&#39;t complain. He said it was flavorful but his mashed potatoes were lukewarm as well but the green beans were good. We also ordered Long Island ice teas which were perfection! We would definitely get those again. Lastly, we ordered our cheesecakes to go, one vanilla bean and one banana. The vanilla bean is excellent and it&#39;s my go to Cheesecake because I don&#39;t like very rich deserts and this Cheesecake has a nice balance. The same goes for my husband&#39;s banana cheesecake, it was great! Same thing, very good and not too rich! Overall food was good, service was ok and we will return. I took off two stars for the service and the calamari.

Had a gift card that I needed to use, so I stopped in this evening for dinner. Service was excellent. My servers&#39; name was Hailey (sp?) and she was excellent! She knew I was having dinner by myself, so she gave me space but was very attentive. My drink glass was never empty, which was a first for me at this restaurant. I started with the spinach and cheese dip and my main course was the Ribeye steak. The appetizer was good, a little on the room temperature side instead of hot like I would have preferred, but the flavor was delightful. My Ribeye I ordered Rare and it was cooked perfectly, very juicy and tender. Will definitely be back to see this server again!

One afternoon I brought my mother here to try something new. The service was passive and curt and the food lacked any flavor whatsoever. I myself got the herb crusted salmon and shrimp scampi combination. Not only did it lack flavor but I also didn&#39;t receive any of the pasta that went with the scampi. My mother had gotten sauce that obviously went bad as well. Not to mention a milkshake that had to be reordered twice and didn&#39;t arrive until the end of the meal. Definitely not coming here again. Way too overpriced for poor service, and product.

I was on a Girls trip when we all decided to end our trip at The Cheesecake Factory. The beginning of our late lunch started out fine besides not receiving the bread which is usually provided. The appetizers were extremely good but everyone at the table started to receive their food. Even though, I was the first to order I didn&#39;t receive my food after waiting for 1 hour. I asked to directed to the first manager ,&#34; She stated there&#39;s nothing she could do but rush the kitchen&#34;. At the point, I couldn&#39;t eat my order finally came out and my friends had completely finished . So, I asked politely for my ticket and the waiter gave all individuals their tickets. A sprite had been added but I changed to a water with lime because it was watered down. The server then snatched the ticket out of my hand. At first, I was over the entire and so the others suggested that spoke with another manager which I did and he handled the issue. I have never had an experience such as this. Note: the pasta was not good at all.

I visited the restaurant for the second time on July 20th with 2 friends and the customer service was horrible. I placed an order for chicken pot stickers and a libation only to be informed 20 minutes later that the kitchen was out of the item. Our waiter was excellent he tried to do everything in his power to help but as I looked around the surrounding tables other pardons were having issues with their meals. The second problems was a woman came by our table without introducing herself and informed a 2 member of our 3 party table that the kitchen was out of the lemon herb chicken. I asked if she was the manager and she said yes and informed her that this was the second item our table ordered and the kitchen doesn&#39;t have the item. The manager was not accommodating at all and it&#39;s apparent that she could less if we returned. We asked for our checks which took an additional 20 minutes. When we exited the hostesses didn&#39;t thank us for coming because they were occupied holding a personal conversation. I will never attend this location again.

I went here with my 14 year old for dinner, when we ordered and during the entire time we were there we were the servers only table. It took 15 minutes before he finally came to take our order. I ordered fried mac and cheese and an appetizer, chicken carbonara, and he got a cheeseburger with fries. The appetizer was good but the chicken carbonara which was almost 30 bucks was watery and tasteless and cold. Portion size was tiny. His cheeseburger and fries were both cold. I sent it back and the manager came over and asked if i wanted something different. I said yes she gave me a menu but the server didn&#39;t come back for another 20 minutes I said forget it. I paid and left was pretty upset that I paid 46 bucks for a cold burger and OK appetizer. I called the restaurant to complain and the manager was super nice and helpful said he would give me a refund and took my credit card number but it never came. I called back and they had no idea who or what I was talking about. I disputed the charge with my bank and they contested it so I&#39;m out the money even though they promised me a refund. Will never be back and will make sure I tell everyone how terrible they were.

This place is a joke. Went in to order a slice of cheesecake to go. There was only one couple in front of me at the time. There was one person at the register who was ring up customers and taking call in orders and there was just one person preparing the cheesecakes for the din in customers and the to go orders. After I ordered, the line became  longer. There were about 5 other employees in that area just laughing and talking and pretty much in the way of customers trying to order. None of them went to help yet they were there behind the counter. After about 5 minutes, I noticed that there were about 5 slices of cheesecake lined up on the counter waiting to be bagged. I asked about them and was told that the cashier needed to bag them. I replied, how, when she is taking orders, taking money, and answering the phone. Why couldn&#39;t they help out instead of just standing there wasting space. Finally after showing my agitation, a manager shiwed up to help and one other employee. It&#39;s a shame that I had to step in before anyone came to help those two young ladies. Such poor management, customer service, and courtesy to their fellow coworker. This isn&#39;t my first time experiencing bad customer at this place. Will definitely not give them anymore of my money. Good customer sevice makes for a good dining experience. This is not the case here ever for me.
Great menu! The execution suffers as this restaurant is in Memphis. Service is never predictable or reliable. Be sure to wear Kevlar as this restaurant is located in Hoodchase Mall.

Horrible service. I&#39;ve eaten at Cheesecake Factories all over the country and this restaurant is the worse. My wife and I love the food here and visit the one in Nashville every time we go but we will never be back to this one. When you go these restaurants, you do so with the knowledge that the food is a little higher but the quality and service makes up for it. Not here. Save the money and hit the food court.

I finally had a chance to stop by since its opening. It was a weekday lunch. No lines. No wait. The only other cheesecake factory Ive been to was in San Diego, CA about 10 years ago. To have one in Memphis was just perfect.  Everything I had at my first visit was just perfect. I went at lunch and had regular size meals. I was caught off guard by the large portion sizes but I wasnt complaining. I finished the rest the next day and will order smaller portions my next visit. The atmosphere was great and of course customer service was great as well. No complaints here. I plan to return again.
Loved it. The service was great food was good. And the drinks ... perfect!!! They only down side was the silver wear was sitting on the table with no napkins under it
I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake Factory a couple of times now and I have always had a great time eating here. Food is good and the Cheesecake is AWESOME! Will be coming back for sure!

My husband &amp; I waited 15-20 minutes for a waitress to come &amp; the food takes forever to come. They have bad service here &amp; this has happened twice............ oh 2 stars cause the food is good.
Came for happy hour, food was amazing and only $5.95 per entree, drinks were also $5.95! Rudy and Michael were excellent bartenders! Great atmosphere for girls night or first date....

The two stars are for how fast we were seated and the great service that we received during our meal even though the food wasn&#39;t cooked to The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s standards. First of all our server was very pleasant and I hate I can&#39;t remember her name but she was great. The atmosphere is really nice and the menu is amazing. It&#39;s like reading a book before you order. I would think with all of this preparation that they would deliver better food and hire better managers that can make the situation just a little bit better ever. The wings we ordered were not done,(bloody)the steak was cooked medium instead of medium well, potatoes were cold and the manager didn&#39;t didn&#39;t do anything but help me decide that I will never eat  at The Cheese Cake Factory. Mistakes happens in a restaurant but to have one course cooked improperly and then the second course even worse is not acceptable. The manager only made it worse by not apologizing and not trying to fix the problem. We still tipped the server 35 percent because it wasn&#39;t her fault and she assured us that she told the manager to make sure our entrees were cooked perfectly, not like the raw chicken that were served as appetizer. This is a nice elegant restaurant that should hire better cooks and definitely better managers. I just hope that I don&#39;t get sick. p.s. he did take the wings off and he should have.
Service took forever. Had to send back my daughters order and still couldn&#39;t manage to bring it without tomatoes. Won&#39;t be going back soon. But my daughter did like the cheesecake

This is the worst Cheesecake Factory that I have ever been to.  I have been to the Cheesecake Factory in Atlanta, Chicago, and Las Vegas and the Cheesecake Factory in Memphis, TN is the worst.  I purchased the fish and chips (average $12-$13).  I received three small pieces of fish that were slightly bigger than a McDonald chicken nugget, I did not receive the coleslaw that comes with it, the french fries were overcooked, dry, and cold, the salad was full of wilted lettuce.  I should have went to Captain D&#39;s I would have received better food and more food for my money.

So after reading a few of the reviews on here I felt like i needed to chime in about my experience here. Because either I live in a parallel universe and have been to a completely different restaurant than everyone else or there are a few people on here that are just naturally unhappy people. But going through their reviews it seems like all they do is complain. (I wonder if they ever thought the problem might be with them, constantly getting shitty service everywhere you go? Maybe you should be less of snobby bitch and servers will be nice to you.)<br><br>I have been here approximately a dozen times since its opening. Including training night. Each time I go the hostess staff always makes good conversation with me and most of them remember me from the previous time. Wait times are never unreasonable unless you go during the lunch or dinner rush but that&#39;s to be expected. (Unless you&#39;re the type of person that complains about traffic during rush hour, but common sense can&#39;t be taught so there&#39;s not much anyone can do to help you, yet alone any managers) <br><br>I have both sat at the bar for service and gotten tables. There have been times when service was less then spectacular. But these times usually coincide with dining during the busiest times and most of the mistakes were done by the kitchen not my server. When I brought it up to the server she apologized and had my meal remade and expedited. She even went as far as having a manager comp it off my tab. (The things that happen when you&#39;re a polite human being and recognize that mistakes happen and you don&#39;t have to be a flying douche every time something goes wrong). Even when service was lacking, I once politely informed out server that she had forgotten a condiment request, when she apologized I told her I recognized she&#39;s covering a very large section of the restaurant and that I understand how it could have slipped her mind and to hang in there. You&#39;ll never guess what happened! She brought us a free slice of cheese cake for being understanding. (Again, don&#39;t act like a douche canoe and treat people like humans and they&#39;ll take care of you) <br><br>As far as the bar goes, only once have I gone to the bar where the bartender recognized me, although they do seem to have a large rotating bar staff so that&#39;s understandable. When the bartenders are busy tending the bar and other customers (you know their job?) all it took was for me to open my mouth (that collection of muscles in front of your teeth and contains your tongue) and ask for a drink and service. Low and behold! They came over to help me! I didn&#39;t have to sit 10 mins in passive aggressive silence waiting for them to notice me while attending to 20 other people. <br><br>As far as the food goes, portions are large unless you&#39;re super fat or have a diet of 6000 calories a day be prepared to have left overs or share a meal. Prices are high, it&#39;s a fine dining restaurant, that&#39;s to be expected. You don&#39;t go into dillard&#39;s and expect to pay Walmart prices do you? (If you do, refer to my being a douche references and try to refrain from showing yourself in public, the world is a better place when you sit at home wallowing in your own hate, unless you plan on walking in front of a bus, in that case please continue on with your plans) <br><br>Summary. Don&#39;t be a pain in the ass and you get surprisingly good service. Food is great staff is wonderful. Prices are on the higher side, but you get what you pay for.

This was my first time eating here. I read some bad reviews on Google but.... I have to say OMG I&#39;m coming back! I was nervous at first but now that I had it myself I&#39;m very happy that we came. The bartender Michael S is really nice I had the espresso martini it was to strong for me but still really good, my husband had the strawberry creamsicle OMG that was amazing! For food my husband and I shared the bacon-bacon cheeseburger I wish I had one for myself because it was way to good to share.

First Time trying The Cheesecake Factory and I am a big fan! I went at lunch time on a Monday and there was no wait time. I ordered the Louisiana Chicken Pasta and it was the bomb! I got the lunch portion and still had some leftover for dinner. My daughter had the kid&#39;s pizza and she enjoyed it. I got the classic cheesecake and was not disappointed. I also had to take half of the cheesecake to go. The entire meal was delicious. The only reason I am giving it 4 stars is because it is pricey. Even the lunch menu was pretty high, but I know that will not stop me from coming back and trying some more items on the menu.

Service was great.  Our waiter checked in on us every few mins almost to the point of being needy.  He was great.   The food tasted good but the portions were pitifully.  Wife ordered steak and shrimp, she got 3 shrimp and 4 steak madalions.

Ok , after a 1.5 hour wait, we had the crab cakes, they were very good. I had the mushroom burger, it was cooked to my liking med. it was very good. My wife had the chicken terriyaki, she said it was good. The waitress needed some training skills, but the place was super busy, so I give her some slack. Overall it was okay, not so much to get excited about. It was noisy and very crowded. After the newness wears done, I will go back and try another dish. And we did take home two pieces of chocolate cheesecake.

Great reviews so far. Our server, Kaylie, was wonderful. She checked in on is, took our order in plenty of time, and always took care of us. Our food arrived in a timely manner, and was hot and tasted great. <br>I&#39;m not sure of the negative reviews except for maybe because it was new and everyone wasn&#39;t trained? <br>We were in and out in under an hour on a Sunday afternoon. Granted, it was about 4:45. <br>I ordered the meatloaf and it was wonderful. My husband ordered the chicken Marsala and thought the sauce was a tad sweet but still good. <br>We will certainly be back.

FYI, I sent a version of this to Cheesecake customer service on their website on October 15, 2015 and never received any communication from the company. They do not value their customers...<br><br>My wife was given a $25 gift card for Cheesecake Factory by a co-worker. We had never been to the restaurant and were excited to check it out. We went there on Tuesday, October 13th but the manager was outside and told us that the refrigerator was broken and that their menu was limited to cheesecake, pizza, and salad. We looked at the big menu displayed outside and we decided to try the next day.<br>The next day we came back. It was very busy, unlike the day before, so we knew the refrigerator must have been working. We waited about 10 minutes and were seated. My wife ordered the spicy chicken sandwich &amp; fries and I ordered the dinner version of Evelyn pasta. The food was brought out minus the french fries. The person said the fries would be out soon. Our waitress walked by and made sure we were getting our fries. Our waitress then came back later and said they&#39;d be out shortly because they just started frying some. She came back again and said that it&#39;s taking longer because one of their fryers &#34;exploded.&#34; By that time, we were both finished eating. The fries were finally brought out at the same time as the check and to-go boxes. We then ate the fries, in lieu of dessert, since fries are not good as leftovers re-heated. We were never offered an alternative to the fries, nor any compensation to make up for the inconvenience that ruined my wife&#39;s meal. My wife insisted on speaking to a manager, but I said let&#39;s just wait and email the company. As we were leaving, she insisted again, so she asked the hostess, behind the center table, if she could speak with a manager. The hostess said, &#34;Ok,&#34; and went on about her job. My wife waited approximately 5 minutes and we left without speaking to anyone. Within that 5 minutes, the hostess never followed up or said that the manager was on the way.<br>The whole experience was highly disappointing, especially when you&#39;re spending over $36 (20% tip included) for lunch.

Food was good, the service was not good at all.  We decided to go on a Thursday night at 1930-hrs.  We expected a wait to be seated so that was not bad.  Took them one-hour to get us to a table.  Once we where buzzed, they sent us to another location to wait to be seated.  So two different waits to be seated.  Once seated, it took our waitress (Rachael C) 15-min to come to out table.  We ordered two waters and the Avocado Eggrolls to start.  10-mins later, the waters showed up.  Then our appetizers of the eggrolls which were the sampler rolls not the Avocado Rolls, which is bad because my fiance is a vegetarian and 50% of the sampler is meat related.  Waitress said she was sorry and that was it on that, no &#34;can I put the right order in&#34; or &#34;can I offer you something else&#34;.  Ordered the main meals..our waters were empty, waitress stated she will get us more and she never came back.  Server came with the meals and she was the one that got our waters.  We were always out of our beverage and it was not until we were complete with our meals and sitting looking around, our waitress came back and asked if we needed anything else.  With the horrible service, I stated check only.  We skipped the cheesecake because we did not want to wait another 30-mins to get our dessert.  We did not walk out until 2300-hrs.<br><br>To sum it up:<br>1-hr wait to be seated<br>3-hrs to get one appetizer, main meal and waters (with only one refill)<br><br>I gave it a two because of the food being good but if I could place a star ranking for service it would of been in the negative side.

I had the worse experience at this fairly new location. Well, the hostess was extremely nice!!!<br>But my waitress.... UGH, DOUBLE UGH!!<br><br>My waitress name was Jenny and she was horrible.<br>Let&#39;s begin with the drink order.. I regret to inform you that we waited 20 minutes on straws, only for me to get up and locate another waiter for straws.<br>She forgot to put in our appetizer, which came out a few minutes (3-5) shortly before our entree. <br>She NEVER checked on us for refills- or for ANYTHING for that matter.<br>I actually had to request more water on two different occasions; not to mention, she had a reaction as if I was bothering her.. REALLY?!?<br>Unfortunately, my salmon was not well done, as I requested. I actually had to find another waiter to locate her to send it back... This was after 15 minutes. After sending it back, she managed to check on two more tables with my salmon in her HAND.... (Are you serious)<br>Needless to say, that I will NOT going back to wolfchase, I&#39;d much rather be going back to Nashville for my next cheese cake factory.<br><br>Please please please before sitting, request that you are NOT seated in Jenny&#39;s section.
I have eaten here twice and this by far is the worst Cheesecake Factory I have eaten at. The service is slow and does not pay attention.

I was passing through Memphis while on a business trip and decided to dine with Cheesecake Factory for the first time. Against my better judgement, I ignored the reviews about this particular location. I consider myself to be a foodie, and dine out often. This was the worst experience I have ever had in a restaurant. <br><br>Strike 1 - While being seated, I saw an empty booth and asked if I could have that table, the host told me no. I understand the &#34;rotation&#34; policy with seating servers, but a guest should never be told no on a request that is reasonable. <br><br>Strike 2 - We weren&#39;t greeted by a server for 10 minutes. It took even longer to get drinks out. Or server also did not make a single suggestion or operate by any Step of Service. Being a corporate restaurant, I imagine servers are trained on what a step of service is. What I did see, was servers standing around not working. All congregating around the POS systems and chatting, not waiting in line to ring things in. I saw a staff that did not practice teamwork, or Full Hands In/Full Hands Out. Our server was clearly busy and dealing with more than she could handle. She was triple sat, which is an unacceptable practice and your hosts are setting up your servers for failure. Not once did I see a manager floating around or doing table visits so I could express my concerns. After placing the entree order and waiting 45 minutes, and the appetizer still had NOT arrived, we decided to leave. <br><br>In conclusion, my experience was terrible and I will never return and encourage others to do the same. Just because your company name is a chain restaurant, does not mean you have to operate like one. As we left my partner made the comment, &#34;this restaurant is dead, it can&#39;t even be repaired.&#34; We weren&#39;t expecting &#34;fine dining,&#34; but we did expect to be treated as guests, not customers. A 45 minute appetizer is unacceptable, a 10 minute wait for a greet is unacceptable. A manager should have approached us to apologize for dropping the ball. Our server didn&#39;t even apologize. Even McDonalds apologizes if you have to wait longer than expected.

Just horrible service and a wait for no reason.  The food isn&#39;t even worth it. I&#39;ve been waiting for  25 minutes to place my order. This place is horrible. Bad location for Cheesecake Factory. Should have put it in Collierville.

Very subpar food at this location. I mean for it to be a chain, it&#39;s amazing how much different the taste was here as opposed to Nashville and Atlanta. Service was pretty good but the food quality did not seem the same.

Definitely exceeded my expectations! I have had Cheesecake Factory in other cities and was very excited to hear we (Memphis) was getting our very own! My coworker has her own blog and was invited to do a tasting. Luckily, she invited me as well! The staff was amazing...very friendly. Mikki was our server and she did a marvelous job at explaining the menu, and making suggestions. It was extremely crowded but you would&#39;ve never known due to the fast service!! For the appetizer, we ordered the Vietnamese egg rolls..excellent choice to get the meal started. I had the chicken enchiladas for my entree and it was very tasty! My choice for beverage was the Georgia Peach...it tastes just like a peach! It&#39;s an alcohol beverage...not for the kiddies! Dessert!!!! Awww...the best thing ever... We got a chance to try their new flavor...salted carmel cheesecake...to die for!!! If you want outstanding service and good food this is the place to try!

Service was decent and the food was alright. I have been to better locations in other parts of the country. There wasn&#39;t anything to complain about but wasn&#39;t anything impressive enough to write about either.

Wait staff was very friendly. Seating and wait times are always an issue. We went on a rainy Tuesday night and it was still a long wait. The food and atmosphere are amazing. There menu was like 100 pages long so I am sure there is something for everyone.

Went here for my uncle&#39;s birthday during Sunday brunch.  The place was busy and we had a short wait to get a table but the staff were all friendly and accommodating.  Our server was great and the food was better than I was expecting.  I would definitely come back.
Food was great, but the service could be better. We had to wait numerous times for our bartender to even check on us. The bar back was better than the actual server.

I&#39;m pleasantly surprised they got the kinks out!  Friendly hostesses, no wait, very efficient and friendly server named Beth, and the food prepared exactly as it should be matching all other Cheesecake Factory locations.  Way to go Memphis!  We started with the calamari, it was hot and tasty but perhaps too salty.  Then I had the chicken club sandwich with a side salad and hubby had the Luau salad.  Our favs came just as we liked em.  Finished with a red velvet cheesecake to go and we had a nice meal out on a Tuesday!  Beth did not rush us but checked on us frequently and was quick to get the check back when our daughter was anxious to leave.  I can&#39;t wait to come back with the girls for cheesecake and coffee!

The service and the cheesecake was nice. The food was nasty. I had the meatloaf and literally could only take two bites. Management was nice and allowed me to switch out for the pasta but the noodles were under done. The location is very busy. Overall I&#39;d only come for drinks and cheesecake.

Great great great place to eat. I only gave 4 stars instead of 5 due to the sheer amount of items on the menu. They have anything and everything you can think of...Chinese, Italian, American, Cajun, everything lol. But everything tastes amazing. The meatloaf was delicious as was the Jamaican shrimp. But the center of it all is of course the cheesecake. They have so many varieties and every single one of them is so good. They have a convenient counter just to order the cheesecake so you don&#39;t have to wait at a table just for desert.

So I decided to visit the Cheesecake Factory for a family members birthday. My experience was terrible from beginning to end. We arrived around 6 to be seated at a table for 7. We were told that the wait would be 60 mins, but over 2 hours later we still were not seated. The hostess decided to argue with me about the fact that she said my table was ready WHEN IT WAS NOT! Then she told me that she was talking to someone next to me?!?!?! Literally NOBODY was next to me. Our server was sweet and had a positive attitude however she was stretched thin. Take my advice and head to Nashville if you want service with a smile.

im giving a one star because it took almost two hours for us to be seated while constantly being told that it would be 5 more minutes because they were cleaning the table.. well when we finally got seated it was like they wiped everything on the table on to the floor underneath. after being seated it took a while to order/get our food and when we did we were disappointed the alfredo was dry and overcooked and the chicken sandwich was soggy like it had been sitting there a while and had to walk to the kitchen and ask for fries since the chicken sandwich didnt come with any like it was supposed to. this was really disappointing because it was only the second time I&#39;ve been to cheesecake factory and we were celebrating me and my boyfriends birthdays.
Big disappointment. They brought our food on the  heals of our main course. While the Tex-Mex Egg Rolls were tasty, the shepherd&#39;s pie and ban ban shrimp were below CCF standards.

My husband and I decided to venture out to the Galleria to try the Cheesecake Factory during our recent visit to Memphis. We have never eaten at one before. I know, unbelievable right? We normally avoid chains on vacation and stick to local food. I had the bacon truffle grilled cheese and he had the Riesling chicken (which is what I really wanted, but you have to save room for Cheesecake). His was better than mine, but they were both good. The grilled cheese was messy and a little tough to bite into, but still tasty. After we ate the obligatory meal, it was Cheesecake time! I ordered the celebration Cheesecake and he had the lemon meringue. Both were good but the celebration cake was better. The layer of strawberry mousse was the best part. I couldn&#39;t eat it all because it was huge, so my husband got to eat my leftovers later in our hotel room. I would definitely recommend the celebration Cheesecake for anyone who likes cake, Cheesecake, mousse and cream cheese icing. It doesn&#39;t get much better than that combination! (I could do without the crunchy sprinkles though)
Too expensive, over $70 for two burgers and two small slices of cheesecake. Service is slow, burgers are good. Oh, and they opened 15 minutes late while people froze in the rain.

It&#39;s nice but it&#39;s just too busy and too small!  And what&#39;s up with the lady behind serving the Cheesecake individually! I mean she is not happy or something she doesn&#39;t even smile and sounds like she&#39;s not pleased with her assignment,  but she does thank you for coming but her eyes just are hateful to me! Service with a smile is not just a d slogan it should be a mission.
Table was had sticky caked on ketchup on it, and staff was extremely rude.   Extremely.  And that was the manager. Horrible. Will never return. Oh... And would not refill tea.

We went for a Saturday morning breakfast--they only have brunch on Sunday but there were plenty of omelets and other appropriate options.  I was really impressed with the service and apart from that it was the Cheesecake Factory quality I&#39;ve come to expect and massive portions: the smoothie was even huge!
The service was not good at all. Asked to speak to a manager about the quality of my food and he never showed. Will not be back.

I decided to try something different and ordered the Shepherd&#39;s Pie. It tasted great. Of course, I had cheesecake. Stayed more traditional and had strawberry cheesecake. It was delicious. Going back soon to try the seasonal peppermint bark cheesecake. Service was good. We were seated rather quickly but had to wait approx 20-35 minutes to get out food.
Not so good food.  Ordered evelyn pasta and the cook doesn&#39;t know the ingredients. She had go back and rebook it and bring it. Not good

DON&#39;T ASK QUESTIONS. Take your little beeper thing and sit down or the hostesses will embarras you in front of everyone.  Don&#39;t complain on them either.  Good is average at best but be prepared to wait an hour and half to find out regardless what they tell you at the front desk.  Make sure you ask for ice in your beverage too. We have been 6 times but it&#39;s always an ordeal so we have since retired from there this evening.  $15 for a sandwich and specialties run a little higher.  Cheesecake is high but it&#39;s pretty good. Wouldn&#39;t want to fight the staff though.  It will be you and like 29 others upset with the wait and ect so at least you won&#39;t be alone.

Ive been to several cheesecake factories around the country and this has been by far the worst. Granted, I know its new and trying to get up and running but man.<br><br>I went on a Saturday night so I expected it to be crazy. We got there at 8:00. Was told the wait would be 80 minutes which was fine. We went into the mall and shopped and went back. We waited about 20 minutes before our buzzer went off.<br><br>They send you to another location to wait where theres complete chaos and you aren&#39;t sure who your supposed to be looking for or whos seating you. It was a very confusing set up. Someone started yelling our name and 8 feet away was the person seating us.<br><br>We were seated and immediately greeted. Server took water orders and took several minutes to return. She came with no bread and stated that the kitchen as backed up. About 15 minutes later she finally came with bread. We went ahead and ordered our food.<br><br>She came by several times and would peek into booth but not close enough where I could tell her we need more bread and water. We had our empty bread basket sitting close to the edge trying to give her a hint to ask for more bread. The next thing I know a completely different server walked by and grabbed the bread basket as he walked by so fast that I couldn&#39;t ask for more.<br><br>This was ridiculous. We were thirsty, breadless, and our waitress was no where to be found.<br><br>Our food finally came. Mine was pipping hot. I got the Cajun pasta. My buddy got the salmon and mashed potatoes with asparagus which came out COLD and seasonless. It tasted horrible.<br><br>Our waitress never came back and I had an empty glass forever it seemed like.<br><br>She finally refilled and we ordered cheesecake. It took 20 minutes for a slice of cheesecake to go to come out.<br><br>Okay food but ridiculous service.

I visited and the food and service was good. I went on a Thursday at lunchtime. Not too long a wait and the waitress was good. The food was good but it not the Cheesecake ambience I&#39;m used to in larger cities like ATL and St. Louis. Overall, it was okay.

Have Dessert Only. Our server gave our table to another server after taking our drink order. But she was great. The portions are great but the food was bland and prepared slowly. Probably won&#39;t visit on a Saturday night ever again.
We attended with a very large party and our server was very attentive at all times. Very large gluten free menu that was absolutely delicious. Look forward to returning to try new items soon.

Aside from the wait and it being a chain restaurant, we had a very good experience. Little on the pricey side but the food was defiantly worth the money. And had one of the best peach Bellini&#39;s I have ever had. I defiantly recommend the Godiva cheesecake for dessert. It is amazing!
Amazing drinks, amazing food, and amazing service! Wait time was a less than 15 minutes and hostess was amazingly pleasant . What more can I say!
My only complaint - too much to choose from! <br>We waited forever - because our pager was broken.<br>But the staff was great. The food was delicious. <br>The price okay.  ;)

The food was really well made but the service was absolutely terrible. It took over an hour for them to seat us. Our poor waitress was completely overwhelmed with all of her tables, it took her at least 15 minutes to bring us our drinks. We recorded our burgers about twenty minutes before we ever had our fries brought to us. When we talked to the manager, he didn&#39;t seem to care and stated he was leaving for Texas soon. Overall, the food is not worth such a terrible experience.

Worst service ever!  30 min wait for drinks, apps. 1 additional hour wait for food which was cold.  Manager unimpressive with explanation. Been to many of these out of town. Good experiences there. Please hire new management staff for this location.

I went with My boyfriend on a Friday night at 6:30pm. We waited and didn&#39;t get seated until 7:20pm (which was fine being that it&#39;s brand new and all.)  They took our order and we waited an hour for our food to arrive. The service was horrible. No one came out to tell us why it took so long to bring us our food, until 5 minutes before Mine was ready. It was just a big waste of time. We didn&#39;t leave until 9:00pm. If they had better service , then the money spent would be worth it. Also I got extremly sick after I got home. Save your money. So not worth it.

On a Wednesday got right in with no wait. Service was excellent. Food was good except my wife&#39;s pasta was underdone. The cheesecake was as good as you would expect. We&#39;ll go there again next time we are in the area.
Lettuce wraps are out of the world.   Other food is good.  Service needs a great deal of work.  My meal was ice cold, asked to have it reheated.  Waited 30 minutes.  Ridiculous.
New to memphis, the cheesecake factory is delightful place for dates or small gatherings. Food is great and so is the service.
Did not want to write a bad review but food from yesterday i am totally disappointed. Uncooked food.

Ordered a ribeye and my girlfriend ordered a burger. The bread we got waiting for the meal was stale (have dined at other locations we know what to expect and had standards set). The ribeye was too thin without enough fat to really be a true ribeye, which was disappointing for the price. My girlfriend said the burger was just a burger, nothing special (I could have gotten her a nothing special burger for at least $5 cheaper from anywhere else but she wanted to go here). I asked the waitress for a second beer and never got it. We both ordered some version of a chocolate cake (Linda&#39;s fudge and the black out) to go and that was truly the only enjoyable experience about the meal.

I&#39;ve been to the new one they opened about six months ago in memphis, tn four times. Three out of the four visits went perfect with great service and excellent food. <br>The fourth visit didn&#39;t go so well, I tried the orange chicken and had to send it back. The chicken was fried perfectly crisp but that was about the only thing they got right. The only thing I could taste was oil until I dug for the orange sauce, which was almost none existant. Under the chicken the carrots tasted like charr. All around it was a bad dish. I wasn&#39;t going to try that dish again so I got the Chipotle chicken and  noodles instead and it was ok. Not all together the best visit.<br>Despite the one poor experience I will be back and would still recommend it to others. The cheesecake is always work the guilt.<br>Prices are a little higher but the portion sizes are huge, plan on getting two meals out of any dinner. If you don&#39;t want left overs go with some who has similar taste and share. But not the cheesecake, you never share that.

I love the cheesecake factory just not this location. The food is just not cooked well compared to others i have tried up north. The service is questionable and i feel like the prices could be spared based on the fact this is just not a very good representation of the cheesecake factory
Surprisingly the Cuban sandwiches was one the better ones I&#39;ve had. We had great service from our server David and we&#39;ll be back.
Our service was amazing! Wendy was sweet, knowledgeable of the menu and so attentive! The food was delicious, bar drinks were stellar! Great place and visit! Will definitely be back again!

So, I gave them another chance. We have been back several times and the service has been great each time. The factory hamburger and fries is so good. I also had a salad with grilled chicken and avocado.  Absolutely delicious. So glad we have this restaurant in the mall.

I got the Cheesecake Factory to go and it was ready super fast for a crowded Saturday night. The food however was pretty sloppy and average. I got the bistro shrimp something I always get and was very disappointed pasta had no flavor and hardly no sauce, then I only had 5 shrimp Wtf!!!

Great server! Poor customer service. When a server turns in an order for a dessert they should be advised quickly if the dessert is not available! Don&#39;t make a customer wait 15 to 20 minutes just to find out that they can&#39;t get their order and then serve the other person with them. This is the second time it&#39;s happened here and not sure there will be a third chance. Only came for coffee and dessert

We waited twenty minutes to sit down, seated and waited 5 minutes before the server came by. Then waited another five minutes for drinks.  The poor timing was never an issue because our server was so polite and kind.  Waited for our food, which didn&#39;t take too terribly long, but was delivered by the MOST impolite server.  She was a tall, dark skin female with black hair in a long pony tail.  She delivered our food to the wrong table next to us, turned around and delivered it to us without bothering to speak or smile.  She returned with our kids food and did the same after a 10 and 4 year old said thank you to the arrival of their food.  She completely ruined our experience and we won&#39;t be returning.  It was appalling how rude she was.  As I&#39;m in the restaurant writing this, the exact same girl just brought the table next to us and handed a woman an extremely hot plate, and ignored her completely.  She has no business working in a restaurant.  This is the same table that had a man get up to refill his own drink.  How embarrassing.

The only reason I gave the one star was because of the slice of cheesecake. The wait after my wife and I was seated was over twenty minutes. After we ordered our food it was another twenty minutes before it arrived. I had the chicken alfredo which was cold and the noodles were hard. My wife was less than thrilled with her steak and salmon, but at least it was edible. Our waitress...let me stop here it gets worse. That was our first and last time eating at the Cheesecake Factory.

Not the BEST CF I&#39;ve ever been to, but also definitely not anywhere near the worst. Have had some trouble receiving correct orders (the waiter had it right, so I assume some wires got crossed in the kitchen) and another person in my group got a rather low-quality burger once, but other than that it&#39;s been relatively solid. Just expect to wait awhile for food during busy hours (standard procedure for any CF, really). Definitely worth visiting if you&#39;ve yet to experience a CF or are in town with a craving.

Came up from Arkansas to go to Ikea for my birthday, decided to eat at The Cheesecake Factory, I&#39;ve haven&#39;t been there in years (I visited the one in Baltimore weekly before we moved to the south) so we arrived impressed no wait! Saw there were empty booths but had to sit at a half booth table because the booth wasn&#39;t wiped down. So we sit. Waitress comes right up, drinks, blah, blah... we&#39;re looking around table next to us has been there for 10 minutes nothing.. other table is leaving and their getting better service. We finally get our drinks! We order an appetizer.. 30 minutes later (still watching our waitress hovering over table that has to go boxes) she comes back and asked if we need refills not are y&#39;all ready to order...? Appetizers delivered food still not ordered... (came out wrong/ waitress still serving table that has now paid for their meal) I was like y&#39;all let&#39;s go to McDonald&#39;s where they decided if your getting onions or not! We been on the road for 3 hours... My mom said no I have what I want made up.. 20 minutes after our order the waitress says we&#39;re out of what you want... mom went with something else.. I ordered the steak Diane good steak couldn&#39;t taste the pepper, was missing vegetable, but tons of mash potatoes that were raw...  just blah..

My best friend wanted to take me out for my birthday. She wanted it to be a special visit to show appreciation for me. Haven eaten at another Cheesecake Factory we decided to give the one in Memphis a try. First our server seem to be inexperienced or new so service was a little slow to start, then he was sat a nine person table right next to us. He took our order, then came back because they were out of one of the entrees we ordered. I ordered a salad with no olives and an entree. About 30 minutes later our entrees were delivered then my salad came after the entrees arrived...with olives (lots of them). Finally we call manager over and told her situation, even told her we were there for my birthday. She asked if we wanted a different server....at this point only thing left was dessert to order ...we said no (giving server every chance). Another server came and checked on us even discussed my birthday (how they were gonna embarrass me). We ordered dessert (cheesecake go figure). Our server brought us the check before our desserts were delivered, ran the credit card still before desserts arrived. Then brought our desserts over and dropped them off. My best friend started to cry...this build up to special night and you drop off our desserts and don&#39;t say (or sing happy birthday) Now the night is ruined and we are both stunned. I am half way through eating my dessert when server asked my name... with a group of servers to sing happy birthday...I was almost done eating....seemed they missed the moment. Missed the whole concept of &#34;Special Night&#34;. The food was good (except salad) but I can find that type a food in plenty of other restaurants. My recommendation is NOT to go here if your celebrating anything that is important to you or your party!

Every time I come here I say I&#39;ll never come again because of the service.  The food is consistently good and the people are friendly, but the host and wait staff are mediocre at best. Today we arrived before 5 pm to avoid the Friday dinner crowd and were seated by a &#34;new&#34; host who decided to sit us at a table in a section where the dinner server hadn&#39;t arrived yet. Who knows what time the dinner server is supposed to arrive, and frankly, who cares. It&#39;s just the latest poor host and wait staff dining experience for my family and I. A very nice server named Jessica greeted us, took our drink orders and said our actual server would be here soon. Drinks and bread came fairly quickly and then we proceeded to wait for almost 20 minutes before Jessica realized our server wasn&#39;t here yet.  Almost 40 minutes after we were seated (and 15 minutes after Jessica took our order and said she&#39;d take care of us) our actual server shows up and then I hear her asking Jessica about our table.  Too late. I&#39;ve eaten at the Atlanta, Nashville and Orlando locations dozens of times and I can&#39;t think of a single bad experience, but the Memphis location is a totally different story.

Took our daughter there for brownie and ice cream. the ice cream is melted we asked three different servers for spoons no one brought any and then when we brought it up to our regular waitress who finally showed up 10 min later she said it&#39;s not her fault normally they set the tables no one fixed it so then we left with a cryingthree-year-old who got no ice cream because all the restaurants ice cream had melted. We just went there for dessert God help anyone that goes there for a full meal

So I finally stopped by the famous Cheesecake Factory. My curiosity was fueled by the Big Bang Theory as the protagonists often eat there.  The menu is crazy!  It&#39;s got practically everything!  If you can&#39;t find something to eat, you&#39;re not hungry!  I had the bacon burger and it did not disappoint.  It was piled high with bacon and was well cooked and seasoned. Everyone in my party enjoyed their food, but the kid&#39;s quesadilla wasn&#39;t anything spectacular.  The service was excellent. Our server came by every few minutes to check on us (granted they weren&#39;t super slammed).  The only real negative point is the price.  It&#39;s pretty expensive.  I don&#39;t think we&#39;ll go back for a casual dinner.  It&#39;s more of a fancy, special place (think anniversary).

I like cheesecake factories a lot, this one is ok maybe because they are so new the kitchen isn&#39;t consistent yet. Some days it&#39;s better than others. Also service also depends on luck, sometimes you wait forever and other times ur in and out very quickly. I have tried many things on the menu, my favorites are all appetizers. I like the Thai lettuce wrap, calamari is always good too, avocado egg rolls are good and the tuna tatakki salad is good too.
